issueDTO.title: [BUG] Incorrect first installation of the last bat file
issueDTO.description:
### I have taken steps to troubleshoot my issue first

- [x] I'm using the latest version of `cyberdrop-dl-patched`
- [x] I’ve read the wiki and my issue isn’t already covered.
- [x] I understand this is open source software provided for free and that I might not receive a timely response.
- [x] I’ve checked existing issues to avoid creating a duplicate.
- [x] A similar issue was previously marked as `completed` and the [changelog](https://github.com/jbsparrow/CyberDropDownloader/blob/dev/CHANGELOG.md) says it was implemented, but I'm confident the bug still exists
- [ ] I am willing to submit a pull request with the fix. *(Assign this issue to me.)*

### Describe the bug

Hello! This small error occurs when you first install on a system via a new bat file.

### Steps to help reproduce the behavior

Download the latest release with ready to run bat-files, unzip, and first run file "run start_windows.bat".

### Relevant logs

The first installation is interrupted. But if you run the bat-file again, the script skips the installation and just correct displays “ Disclaimer”.

(The installation log has been created with the required name).
[downloader.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21023120/downloader.log)

### Operating system/environment

Windows 11 23h2

### Python Version

3.13.5

### Cyberdrop-DL version

7.0.0

### Links, references, and/or additional comments?

Thanks for work!

issueDTO.title: Add a default logging.yaml when `meltano init` is invoked
issueDTO.description:
Migrated from GitLab: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/3121

Originally created by @edgarrmondragon on 2021-12-15 18:17:31

---

### Problem to solve

Now that structured logs have been added to Meltano by https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2772, it'd be good if new Meltano projects were initialized with a `logging.yaml` containing some good defaults.

### Target audience

Users starting fresh new Meltano projects.

### Further details

- Logging configuration is present from the start
- Users are aware of configurable logging by virtue of the file being present

### Proposal

The initial `logging.yaml` should probably have both the option for colored logs during development, and JSON logs for production scenarios.

The file should probably include a header with some instructions, links, etc.

Where to look for this in the code:

https://github.com/meltano/meltano/blob/0dad7d51a36862e3df7a9f5cf19425540577e5c9/src/meltano/core/bundle/initialize.yml#L1-L2

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

Users start using and configuring structured logging in their Meltano projects. This increased use should bring more contributions as bug reports and feature proposals.

### Regression test
(Ensure the feature doesn't cause any regressions)
- [ ] Write adequate test cases and submit test results
- [ ] Test results should be reviewed by a person from the team

### Links / references

_Please note that this was taken from GitLab, to be changed accordingly_

issueDTO.title: Add default densification strategy
issueDTO.description:
Currently, this implementation supports only the mcmc densification strategy in mcmc.cpp/hpp. 

The goal of this issue is to implement the default densification.

The base implementation can be ported from: https://github.com/nerfstudio-project/gsplat/blob/main/gsplat/strategy/default.py

However, this can be only a starting point for later improvements.

Solving this issue should give a good understanding how the original densification strategy (adc) works.

issueDTO.title: "parameterizable" decorator
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a use case or problem? Please explain

Parameterization requires a bunch of boilerplate (`_is_parameterized_`, `_parameter_names_`, `_resolve_parameters_`, all of which just check / replace the specified member variables). It seems like something a decorator could handle well.

## Describe the solution you would prefer

It'd be great if in #5985, the solution could just be "add the decorator to `QasmUGate`", something like 

```python
@parameterizable("theta", "phi", "lmda")
class QasmUGate(ops.Gate):
```

## How urgent is this for you? Is it blocking important work?

<!-- Please choose one of the following options and remove the others -->
**P3** – I'm not really blocked by it; it's an idea I'm proposing based on principle

## Process Note

For anyone wanting to take this issue, it's probably worth a mini [RFC](https://github.com/quantumlib/Cirq/blob/main/docs/dev/rfc_process.md) and finding a maintainer (not me) to sponsor it before starting work (assuming this even gets to triage/accepted state). While it's probably below the "RFC Required" bar, I think there are enough variables, that having an approved design would be beneficial. (Some things that come to mind: What happens if only some fields are parameterizable? Can/should it work both with dataclasses and with non-dataclasses? Can the implementations be overridden in classes it's applied to? How to apply it in gate class hierarchies (e.g. at the EigenGate level or at each subtype?) Does it interact with mypy typing in any way or are type declarations independent? What's the best way to test it? Is it worth going back and retrofitting existing gates into this model?)

repository.description: An open-source Python framework for creating, editing, and invoking Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum (NISQ) circuits.
repository.name: Cirq

summary.main: The issue is about creating a decorator for parameterization, specifically for the QasmUGate class. The decorator would handle the boilerplate code required for parameterization.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires a mini RFC (Request for Comments) and finding a maintainer to sponsor it before starting work. The design should be approved before implementing the solution.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue is still open and no fixes have been attempted yet.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to parameterization and requires a bunch of boilerplate code. The proposed solution is to add a decorator to the QasmUGate class. The issue is not blocking important work and is considered P3 (not really blocked by it; it's an idea I'm proposing based on principle).

issueDTO.title: Number of children served -- should not include archived children.
issueDTO.description:
# Summary
Don't count archived children in Total Number of Children served (on bank's view of partner)
# Why?
If a child has been archived, they are no longer being served
# Details
## Where the Total Number of Children referred to above appears
Sign in as org_admin1@example.com
Click Partner Agencies, then "All Partners"
Click on "Pawnee Parent Service"  (this is the partner used below).  This shows the bank's  view of that paratner
The number of children served is shown in the second section.
## Where to archive a child
Sign in as verified@example.com
Click on Children in the left hand menu
Choose a child and "Edit Child Details"
Near the bottom, there is an "Archived?" checkbox.   
Toggle it to checked, and click "Update Child"
## What we need
The number of children in the bank's partner view reflects only the non-archived children for the partner.  Changes to a child's archived status will be reflected in this value.
# Criteria for completion
- [ ] Behaviour as described above
- [ ] automated tests that confirm the behaviour

# Origin

issueDTO.title: Optimize circuit construction when Insert is used
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a use case or problem? Please explain

#6882 created a cache that sped up circuit construction if only "append" (or equivalent "insert" at end w/ EARLIEST strategy) was used. If other types of "insert", "delete", or any other circuit mutation was used (see instances of `_placement_cache = None`), the cache was simply deleted and subsequent mutations (including appends) fell back to the old "check every moment" algorithm.

## Describe the solution you would prefer

There are probably some clever algorithms or data structures that could maintain the placement cache through more types of mutations. Or another option could be if the placement cache was deleted and subsequently the user calls a few "appends" in a row, to assume there are more coming and have some code that regenerates the placement cache a-priori. (It'd be nice to see some real-world use cases of large circuits that use mutations other than "append", to make sure any solution is optimizing the right thing).

## How urgent is this for you? Is it blocking important work?

<!-- Please choose one of the following options and remove the others -->
**P3** – I'm not really blocked by it; it's an idea I'm proposing based on principle

repository.description: An open-source Python framework for creating, editing, and invoking Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum (NISQ) circuits.
repository.name: Cirq

summary.main: The issue is about optimizing circuit construction when 'Insert' is used, which is related to a previous issue #6882 that created a cache to speed up circuit construction when only 'append' or equivalent 'insert' at end with EARLIEST strategy was used.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to optimize circuit construction when 'Insert' is used, possibly using clever algorithms or data structures to maintain the placement cache.
summary.attemptedFixes: The proposed solution is to maintain the placement cache through more types of mutations, or to delete the placement cache and subsequently regenerate it when the user calls a few 'appends' in a row.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to a previous issue #6882, which created a cache that sped up circuit construction when only 'append' or equivalent 'insert' at end with EARLIEST strategy was used.

issueDTO.title: Add sysfs helpers
issueDTO.description:
## Background

When debugging anything related to a device driver, the first step is often finding the `struct device` that represents the device in the kernel. One way to find a device is by its sysfs path. However, drgn doesn't currently have an easy way to do that. You can _kind of_ do it with something like:

```
>>> path = path_lookup("/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:06.0/0000:04:00.0/nvme/nvme0/nvme0n1")
>>> kn = cast("struct kernfs_node *", path.dentry.d_inode.i_private)
>>> kobject = cast("struct kobject *", kn.priv)
>>> device = container_of(kobject, "struct device", "kobj")
```

But this has a few issues:

* Clearly it's not convenient at all.
* `path_lookup()` walks the dentry cache, which may not be populated for a particular path depending on memory pressure.
* `path_lookup()` doesn't resolve symlinks (yet, see #216), so you have to use the canonical path instead of a more convenient symlink like `/sys/block/nvme0n1`.

Instead, we should improve our kernfs helpers and provide sysfs-specific helpers on top of those. This can be broken down into multiple smaller features.

## kernfs

sysfs is actually an instance of [kernfs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kernfs_(Linux)), which is generic infrastructure for pseudo file systems. A kernfs filesystem comprises a tree of [`struct kernfs_node`](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/include/linux/kernfs.h?id=1d227fcc72223cbdd34d0ce13541cbaab5e0d72f#n181), each of which represents a file or directory.

We already have a few basic helpers for inspecting kernfs: https://drgn.readthedocs.io/en/latest/helpers.html#kernfs. I would like two extensions to those:

- [ ] Add a `kernfs_children()` helper that returns an iterator over the children of a directory in kernfs. Children are represented by [`struct kernfs_node::dir::children`](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/include/linux/kernfs.h?id=1d227fcc72223cbdd34d0ce13541cbaab5e0d72f#n156).
- [ ] Extend the `kernfs_walk()` helper to follow symlinks. These are represented by [`struct kernfs_node::symlink::target_kn`](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/include/linux/kernfs.h?id=1d227fcc72223cbdd34d0ce13541cbaab5e0d72f#n171). We should probably also have a `follow_symlinks` parameter that controls what we do if the last component of a path is a symlink, similar to the Python [`os`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/os.html#files-and-directories) module.

## sysfs

Once we have the kernfs changes, we can add sysfs-specific helpers that use the new kernfs features.

- [ ] Add a `sysfs_lookup_node()` helper that returns the `struct kernfs_node *` at a given path.
- [ ] Add a `sysfs_lookup()` helper that returns the actual object (e.g., `struct device *`, `struct bus *`, etc.) represented by a given path.
- [ ] Add a `sysfs_listdir()` helper that lists the names of the children of a sysfs directory at a given path.
comments: I am interested in implementing this.

issueDTO.title: Backward call per loss
issueDTO.description:
Try to compute the backward after every loss. Run the benchmark. Verify memory consumption.

https://github.com/MrNeRF/gaussian-splatting-cuda/blob/9bfd4f22bf191744e9f03df5d1b59bd500a3034e/src/trainer.cpp#L220

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d3b440c8-6467-4df9-bbfd-9490733709e6)


Inspired by: https://x.com/gabriberton/status/1796531585958985941?s=61
comments: Is the idea to split the compute_loss function into separate TV, SSIM, and L1 functions, then perform backprop on each one separately?

Yeah. But I think you will need to group the photometric losses, i.e in pseudo code:

Loss = l1(img,gt) + ssim(img,gt)
Loss.backward
...

In our case there would be 3 backward calls in total.

I wonder if this has a measureable impact on memory or runtime. Does it break, when you don't group the photometric losses but call instead backward 4 times?
I did a quick experiment in my environment, and the result looks like this: Although it might reduce memory usage, I'm not sure if it's always the case. This is a result of a different run:

From the figures it seems on average to have lower mem consumption but not on peak. Interesting.

Which scene is this? And I assume you have the 3 backward calls? @Tomoya-Matsubara

> Which scene is this? And I assume you have the 3 backward calls?

It's drjohnson from [tandt_db](https://repo-sam.inria.fr/fungraph/3d-gaussian-splatting/datasets/input/tandt_db.zip).

There were 4 backward calls,

1. Photometric loss
2. Scale regularization loss
3. Opacity regularization loss
4. TV loss

but since I didn't enable the bilateral grid, it was 3 in reality.

Thank you! 

Could you also do a run with bilateral grid enabled to see the impact? 

Then, I think you can create a pr to get this into master.
Sure!

Btw, if someone’s lurking here, there’s another good issue to get a bit more familiar with the code open to be grabbed:
https://github.com/MrNeRF/gaussian-splatting-cuda/issues/152

issueDTO.title: Add SSMRunCommandOperator
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Amazon Systems Manager (SSM) is used by system admins to manage AWS resources like EC2. It also provided ability for companies to run scripts on the EC2 machines securely using it's RunCommand feature. Adding SSM RunCommand Operator to the Amazon provider package will unlock migration to Airflow from legacy job scheduling frameworks like AutoSys

### Use case/motivation

I work with a few customers that are in the process of migrating jobs from AutoSys and other legacy frameworks to Airflow. For these customers, a lot of their existing jobs are in shell scripts running on EC2. When they migrate to Airflow, they are looking for an easy way to lift those scripts and run on Airflow. SSHOperator could be an option for this but in many corporate environments, SSH is disabled for security reasons. One of the secure ways AWS recommends executing a remote script on EC2 is by using SSM RunCommand.

### Related issues

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit a PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issueDTO.title: [Rolldown] Use `filter` pattern for Vite hooks
issueDTO.description:
### Feature Request

In some plugins WXT uses, we use `resolveId`, `load`, and `transform` to modify specfic files. We need to use [the `filter` feature](https://rolldown.rs/guide/plugin-development#plugin-hook-filters) to take advantage of rust.

The plugins that need updated are in the [`packages/wxt/src/core/builders/vite/plugins` directory](https://github.com/wxt-dev/wxt/tree/main/packages/wxt/src/core/builders/vite/plugins).

There are not unit tests for each of these plugins, but they are covered by E2E tests. So if `pnpm test` passes after your changes, nothing is broken.

#### Is your feature request related to a bug?

Apart of #1677

### What are the alternatives?

Leave it as is and not take advantage of the native rust code.

issueDTO.title: Allow `default` keyword as `update` value for generated columns
issueDTO.description:
MySQL:
```sql
mysql> create table t (i int primary key, j int generated always as (i + 10));
Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.01 sec)

mysql> insert into t (i) values (1);
Query OK, 1 row affected (0.01 sec)

mysql> select * from t;
+---+------+
| i | j    |
+---+------+
| 1 |   11 |
+---+------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

mysql> update t set j = default;
Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.00 sec)
Rows matched: 1  Changed: 0  Warnings: 0
```

Dolt:
```sql
tmp/main> create table t (i int primary key, j int generated always as (i + 10));
Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.02 sec)
tmp/main*> insert into t (i) values (1);
Query OK, 1 row affected (0.01 sec)
tmp/main*> select * from t;
+---+----+
| i | j  |
+---+----+
| 1 | 11 |
+---+----+
1 row in set (0.00 sec) 


tmp/main*> update t set j = default;
The value specified for generated column "j" in table "t" is not allowed.

```
related: https://github.com/dolthub/dolt/issues/9428

issueDTO.title: Misleading warning in relational interfaces if user is has no read permission
issueDTO.description: ### Describe the Bug The relational interfaces show the message "The relationship hasn't been configured correctly" if a user is missing read permission on the related collection: This warning is misleading and should be changed to something that indicates that the permissions are missing. Obviously, if the relationship is actually configured incorrectly, the above message should still be displayed. Most likely this requires an adjustment of the relations service, as currently the user doesn't receive the necessary information. ### To Reproduce - Create two collections - Setup a relationship of any kind between the two - Create a role & user - Grant access to main collection, while not granting read access on related / junction collection - Login with the user and create a new item, see the interface with the warning as shown in the screenshot ### Directus Version 10 (up to 10.8.3) ### Hosting Strategy N/A
comments:
Hey 👋 I'd like to work on this issue.
My plan is to adjust the relation service to differentiate between:
a misconfigured relationship (e.g. missing collection or metadata)
and a permission issue (the user lacks read access to the related collection)
The idea is to return a more specific status from the backend (e.g. readable: false) and then update the Admin UI to show a clearer message when access is denied, instead of the generic "relationship not configured" warning.
Would this approach work for you? If so, could you assign the issue to me?
Thanks!

summary.attemptedFixes: The proposed solution is to return a more specific status from the backend (e.g. readable: false) and update the Admin UI to show a clearer message when access is denied.

issueDTO.title: Set up Windows build in our CI
issueDTO.description:
Our CI doesn't actually build and test on Windows. This causes no end of despair.

How hard can it be? You don't really need to know anything about OSL internals or even C++ programming. It's mainly about wrangling builds and knowing how such things are done on Windows. Maybe it's even a good Dev Days project? 

[OpenImageIO](https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenImageIO)'s build and CI system is basically the same as OSL's, and it has Windows builds in its CI, so that should provide much of the template (and existence proof) for how this can be done. Probably the hardest part is that unlike OIIO, OSL will need LLVM installed as a dependency.
comments: Hello I would like to look into tackling this issue, I am a new developer and would just like to request some clarification. If I understand correctly the current build and install does not work on Windows and the goal is to get it working on Windows? Or am I missing something since it seems like according to the documentation building and testing on Windows should be possible as it is listed as supported although I have not actually tried to build the project on a Windows machine.
We know that the software can build and run on Windows. But our project's GHA-based CI does not build and test on Windows. That is what we need to fix.

Is that what you are refering to by GHA-based CI? I'm at the point where it starts to build OSL in the Madoodia folder. OSL builds oslcomp.dll, oslnoise.dll and oslquery.dll, oslc.exe, but then I run into an error when it tries to build oslexec.dll. Anyway any help would be appreciated. A lot of this stuff has been pretty new to me coding wise, but I've been trying my best!

Anyway after doing so I ended up only updating OpenImageIO and OpenEXR to slightly newer versions than what was listed in the original build_osl.py file because OSL was looking for Imath, but couldn't find it in ILMBase. So wanted to use a version of OpenEXR when Imath was seperated from it, and then add the same version of Imath as OpenEXR. Creating library C:/madoodia/sdks/osl_release/build/OpenShadingLanguage/lib/Release/oslexec.lib and object C:/madoodia/sdks/osl_release/build/OpenShadingLanguage/lib/Release/oslexec.exp

I tried also adding and setting the flags: "-DLINKSTATIC=ON", "-DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON" to OpenImageIO but this didn't make a difference. I don't understand why this error persists. I'm also using OpenImageIO v2_5_11. So I know in the Install file for OSL it says it will work with v2_5, but wanted to check and make sure that if it's at the tail end of it, there wouldn't be issues (I wouldn't believe so, since this is the version that works with Blender currently).

This is not an issue in your CI work, it's an actual problem in OSL where building shared libs is broken currently, oslexec does not link oslcomp, but does [something a bit naughty](https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenShadingLanguage/blob/main/src/liboslexec/CMakeLists.txt#L143) and gets to the symbols it needs by including the required cpp files from oslcomp into the oslexec build. And seemingly it needs more symbols now, than it needed previously. 

We ran into this today with the blender deps build (no fix as of yet), but this broke somewhere between 1.13.7.0 and the 1.14 beta
Presumably caused by #1890.
Potential fix in #1918, can someone check if it works?
works

How should I go about getting permission to push my commit with the updated CI? And I assume the one that uses the version of OpenImageIO that doesn't require boost, is the commit I should be pushing.

Sorry for the wait on this. After getting the release version of the build setup and working, I moved onto the debug version but ran into some issues which came to a head at pybind11's debug build. This issue gave me a lot of trouble, and I meant to come back to it eventually for a better look later but got caught up in other work. 

Anyway I made mention of the issue in the commit I made on my own fork of the repo, but essentially a repeating error of "IMPORTED_LOCATION not set for important target" is given for a variety of targets such as: "pybind11::module", "pybind11::thin_lto", "pybind11::windows_extras", "pybind11::pybind11", etc.

I believe the reason for this error may be resolved by editing the CMake code regarding pybind11, but if that is the solution then that is something I don't feel comfortable editing. Since all of my focus has been within the build_install directory, when I have had the time to work on this issue.

I continued the debug build past pybind11 by removing it from the list of dependencies to build, and the other dependencies were able to build just fine including the final OSL build. There is one additional error regarding glut.h not being copied into the proper folder, but I gave a list of steps to follow regarding copying the file into it's correct folder (in the Readme). That file is needed by Partio, during it's build.

Besides that I updated various versions of the dependencies, added IMath to build_osl.py, and updated the ReadMe for the build with this new information, including what dependencies needed to be installed by the user and which would automatically be installed by running the Release and Debug versions of the build_osl.bat script. Let me know if there's any other information you need, or anything regarding procedure In need to do for the commit of this issue.

Thanks,
Nate

issueDTO.title: [FR]: New Evaluaton Metric "Trajectory Accuracy"
issueDTO.description:
### Proposal summary

We like to extend the existing evaluation metrics to include a new metric called "Trajectory Accuracy". Esentially we are evaluating ReAct style agents by reasoning about the sequence of actions taken and their outcomes. Based on the paper “ReAct: Synergizing Reasoning and Acting in Language Models” https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.03629. You can also see the Langchain implementation here:
- https://python.langchain.com/api_reference/langchain/evaluation/langchain.evaluation.agents.trajectory_eval_chain.TrajectoryEvalChain.html
- https://github.com/langchain-ai/agentevals/tree/main/python/agentevals/trajectory

Example of an existing judge metric (Hallucination) is defined here:
- Docs: https://www.comet.com/docs/opik/evaluation/metrics/hallucination
- Docs Code: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/apps/opik-documentation/documentation/fern/docs/evaluation/metrics/hallucination.mdx
- Python SDK: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/tree/main/sdks/python/src/opik/evaluation/metrics/llm_judges/hallucination
- Python Examples: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/sdks/python/examples/metrics.py
- Frontend: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/apps/opik-frontend/src/constants/llm.ts

Ideally this is implemented as an LLM-as-a-judge. Expectation is the new judge is added to the frontend for using LLM-as-a-judge from the UI (Online Evaluation tab) as well as in the Python SDK. The appropriate docs needs to be updated and a video attached of the metric working.

Return should be float (0-1), and if its using LLM as a eval then should also contain a "reason/explanation"

### Motivation

I would like to see more robust set of metrics and evaluations based on recent research.

issueDTO.title: Outline Manager fails to create GCP server
issueDTO.description:
### Application

Outline Manager

### Describe the bug

When using GCP option in "ADD SERVER" tab the app hangs on create server step. 
The problem is connected to missing `projects/ubuntu-os-cloud/global/images/family/ubuntu-2004-lts` image that should be used when creating a compute engine instance. 

In GCP logs for compute engine the following error message can be found:
```
The resource 'projects/ubuntu-os-cloud/global/images/family/ubuntu-2004-lts' was not found
```
For reference see [Operating system details](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/images/os-details#ubuntu_lts) section of Compute Engine Documentation. It clearly states that EOS and image deprecation date for tis image is May 2025. 

I suspect the error can be easily fixed by updating [this line](https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-apps/blob/55d09c01704909e1142fd14e2a91d5525872efd0/server_manager/www/gcp_account.ts#L275), but I'm not sure what image is to be used (otherwise I could try to open a PR). 

### Steps to reproduce

1. open Outline Manager
2. connect to GCP account
3. create a project using "ADD SERVER" tab
4. create server using on of the locations (same behaviour is observed for multiple server locations)

### What did you expect to happen?

Successfully completed addition of new server as it was before.

### What actually happened?

I've tried to create a new GCP server using the respective option in "ADD SERVER" tab. 

### Outline Version

1.17.2

### What operation system are you using?

macOS

### Operating System Version

Sonoma 14.6.1

### Screenshots and Videos

_No response_

The user suspects that updating the line in gcp_account.ts could fix the issue, but is unsure what image to use.

issueDTO.title: Change default `rot_method` value from `'pca'` to `'pcahog'`
issueDTO.description:
### Context

While investigating a [user forum issue](https://forum.spinalcordmri.org/t/images-with-different-orientations-fields-of-view/633), I noticed that when not specifying the `-param` flag, the default `rot_method` is set to `pcahog`:

https://github.com/spinalcordtoolbox/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/c5aa82554e4b76262492ff3a7de238ea3c87fd03/spinalcordtoolbox/scripts/sct_register_to_template.py#L60

However, when setting `-param`, the default `rot_method` switches to `pca`, which is counterintuitive:

https://github.com/spinalcordtoolbox/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/ae939b1c3be5f9def829562c82a45cb9dda8dabb/spinalcordtoolbox/registration/algorithms.py#L662-L667

https://github.com/spinalcordtoolbox/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/ae939b1c3be5f9def829562c82a45cb9dda8dabb/spinalcordtoolbox/registration/algorithms.py#L47-L51

Moreover, the `pca` method seems to be less performant (a paper from @Nicolas-Pinon is cooking, demonstrating the better performance of pcahog).

### Suggestion

Set default `rot_method` to be `pcahog`

repository.description: Comprehensive and open-source library of analysis tools for MRI of the spinal cord.
repository.name: spinalcordtoolbox

summary.main: Change default rot_method value from 'pca' to 'pcahog'.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The default rot_method value should be changed from 'pca' to 'pcahog' to align with the default value when not specifying the -param flag.
summary.attemptedFixes: Set default rot_method to be pcahog.
summary.otherNotes: The issue was investigated in the context of a user forum issue and a paper is cooking to demonstrate the better performance of pcahog.

issueDTO.title: No way to copy selected text ?
issueDTO.description:
Hello,

Kudos for the great job !

I've got some issues though :

Using pywinauto I navigate to an input text.
Using type_keys (^a^c) I can select the text, and copy it to the clipboard (I can paste it using ctrl+v manually).
But there doesn't seem to be a way to retrieve it programmatically.
Or am I mistaken ?

In the doc there is a mention to pywinauto.clipboard, but it doesn't work at all for me :

```
>python -m pip install pywinauto --upgrade
Requirement already up-to-date: pywinauto in python\python36\lib\site-packages (0.6.4)
...

>python
Python 3.6.0a1 (v3.6.0a1:5896da372fb0, May 17 2016, 16:21:39) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import pywinauto
>>> pywinauto.clipboard
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'pywinauto' has no attribute 'clipboard'
```

Any help would be much appreciated, thank you for your time.
comments: Found a workaround copying the text in notepad.exe, saving it, and reading the file from python...
`from pywinauto import clipboard` is working. Anyway thanks for the report. I think we should make it available the way you tried. I'll re-open it as enhancement for the future.
@vasily-v-ryabov  How about the approach mentioned [here](https://stackoverflow.com/a/101167/7433942) ?
@badari412 nothing new. I had no time for higher priority issues than this. Also this approach is incomplete, because waiting some lock is required (this is not implemented now).
I would like to work on this issue.

So I tried it on my computer and everything seems to work perfectly fine.
Although what I am not able to understand is how it didn't work for @lc-thomas. It could possibly be that there was something wrong with the import, or maybe the module at the time (2018) was built different, but I would indeed like to investigate further. So if it is possible, could somebody fill me in on the details of the error :D ?

summary.attemptedFixes: Some users suggested workarounds, such as copying the text to a file and then reading it from Python, or using the approach mentioned in a Stack Overflow answer.
summary.otherNotes: lc-thomas reported that pywinauto doesn't provide a way to retrieve the selected text programmatically, even though they can manually copy it to the clipboard. They tried using pywinauto.clipboard but got an AttributeError.

issueDTO.title: Add `SessionConfig` reference to `ScalarFunctionArgs`
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem or challenge?

- Now that https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/13290 is merged (thanks @joseph-isaacs) we have a place to add new 

@Omega359  [noted](https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/13290#discussion_r1852255032) that by adding `SessionConfig` to the `ScalarFunctionArgs`   unblock several tasks such as
- https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/13212
- https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/12892
- https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/10744

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add `&SessionConfig` to `ScalarFunctionArgs`, and ideally add a test that shows the config gets through.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

We should try and get this done before DataFusion 44 is released so it isn't a breaking change
- #13334
comments: Well, small issue. `ScalarFunctionArgs` is in `datafusion-expr` which can't use `SessionConfig` directly since it's in `datafusion-execution` which depends on `datafusion-expr` which would cause a circular dependency. We can use `ConfigOptions` there which would give us access to all config except the opaque extensions in `SessionConfig` which I think is acceptable.
Great work!
Started delving into this trying to find a good way to impl. Trying to add `config_options: ConfigOptions` to `ScalarFunctionExpr` Having lots of fun with eq and hash with SessionConfig and f64 atm.
I wonder if we can use this trait: https://docs.rs/datafusion/latest/datafusion/catalog/trait.Session.html

We could but it wouldn't solve the issue. The issue is PhysicalExpr requires implementations to impl Eq and Hash or to have implementations for DynEq and DynHash. That is fine until something like SessionConfig which doesn't is introduced. I am looking at updating the either the 'config_namespace' macro or add explicit implementations for 'ScalarFunctionExpr' to try and impl either of the above and use f64.to_bits() and f64::from_bits(..) to handle the problematic f64's in the config. I think it's possible
It makes sense to me to move `SessionConfig` to common or common-runtime crate
take

> It makes sense to me to move `SessionConfig` to common or common-runtime crate

I agree
~~I mistyped above - I meant we couldn't use SessionContext, not SessionConfig. Sorry about the confusion.~~ ... or not. I need more caffeine today. PR uses ConfigOptions.
I guess we can also add `nullable` info to `ScalarFunctionArgs` https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/11923

> I guess we can also add `nullable` info to `ScalarFunctionArgs` #11923

It might already be present in `ScalarFunctionArgs::data_type` 🤔 : https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/f2de2c4cc2009d9b6965f7951fd543e1974fcd2c/datafusion/expr/src/udf.rs#L336

> Not really, DataType has no nullable info, we have to send nullable to ScalarFunctionArgs

Ah I was thinking about the nullable info that is part of embedded `Field`s   -- but that only affects Lists/Maps, etc

> Add SessionConfig reference to ScalarFunctionArgs

This is pretty heavy dependency.
SessionConfig contains a LOT of information no scalar function should depend on and very little that has legitimate usage.
I would prefer not adding SessionConfig to ScalarFunctionArgs. Rather, we could add a stripped down config object dedicated to scalar functions. If time zone is all we need, we should add the time zone directly to `ScalarFunctionArgs` (like proposed in https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16573).

https://docs.rs/datafusion/latest/datafusion/execution/config/struct.SessionConfig.html is mostly a wrapper around the ConfigOptions

If we just want specific fields, we could perhaps reuse the existing ExecutionProps

I think the challenge is that 
1. The subset of `ConfigOptions` that functions might want to access is not clear to me
2. User defined functions may well want to use settings we haven't anticipated (and SessionConfig has a user defined way to pass it)

That doesn't mean we couldn't copy a subset of the fields into ScalarFunctionArgs, it just seems unecessary to try and pick that subset 🤔

> If we just want specific fields, we could perhaps reuse the existing ExecutionProps

Are AliasGenerator and VarProviders relevant to function implementors?

> The subset of ConfigOptions that functions might want to access is not clear to me

It's not clear to me either.  We know about session time zone. Session start time may be relevant.
Do we need to know all of them from the start, or just anticipate we gonna evolve set of what's accessible as the need arises?

By avoiding full SessionConfig / ConfigOptions, I would like to retain the state where it's very easy to invoke a function, either from a test, a benchmark, or any other execution context. 

Exposing sub-configs such SqlParserOptions, ExplainOptions, or OptimizerOptions to UDFs looks like breaking abstractions, or invitation to break abstractions.

I think my next attempt at solving this was to take the same approach that async-udf took - which is to move the invocation of the udf into an [ExecutionPlan](https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/0143b20de3f9e25ab8d87ef4b96b78c28e462bee/datafusion/physical-plan/src/async_func.rs#L130). That approach provides the full config_options.

> Exposing sub-configs such SqlParserOptions, ExplainOptions, or OptimizerOptions to UDFs looks like breaking abstractions, or invitation to break abstractions.


In light of a push to reduce breaking changes like https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/16622 (and https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16078, https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16541, https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/13648) we could try to be more judicious about growing the public API. IF we don't need to expose full SessionConfig / ConfigOptions in ScalarFunctionArgs let's maybe not expose them.

> In light of a push to reduce breaking changes like https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/16622 (and https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16078, https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16541, https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/13648) we could try to be more judicious about growing the public API. IF we don't need to expose full SessionConfig / ConfigOptions in ScalarFunctionArgs let's maybe not expose them.

My counter argument is that having to add new fields to ExecutionProps basically increases the public API over time. `ConfigOptions` is already public so it is my opinion that exposing just the `ConfigOptions` is less API surface area. I can see how there are alternate opinions to this

Here is what passing in the entire ConfigOptions looks like (it is pretty straightforward actually): https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16661

repository.description: Apache DataFusion SQL Query Engine
repository.name: datafusion

summary.main: The main goal is to add a SessionConfig reference to ScalarFunctionArgs, which would unblock several tasks and provide a way for scalar functions to access specific fields from ConfigOptions. The issue is currently open and awaiting further discussion and implementation.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to add SessionConfig reference to ScalarFunctionArgs, which would allow scalar functions to access specific fields from ConfigOptions. The validation is to ensure that the scalar function does not depend on unnecessary information from SessionConfig.
summary.attemptedFixes: Several attempts have been made to solve this issue, including adding a stripped-down config object dedicated to scalar functions, reusing the existing ExecutionProps, and exposing specific fields from ConfigOptions. One approach is to move the invocation of the UDF into an ExecutionPlan, which provides the full config_options.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about adding a SessionConfig reference to ScalarFunctionArgs, which would unblock several tasks such as #13212, #12892, and #10744. The main concern is that SessionConfig contains a lot of information that a scalar function should not depend on.

issueDTO.title: Improve test code coverage
issueDTO.description:
Thanks to @okBrian we now have test code coverage (the badge is in the MFC readme). However, we are only at 50% or so. See the lines of code not covered by the test suite here: https://app.codecov.io/github/MFlowCode/MFC/tree/master/src

One fun idea that, in part, addresses this, is using a fuzzer across the inputs to be sure the user does use initial conditions (`case.py` variables) that are nonsense or incompatible.
comments:
We have had several great PRs that improve the code and pass the tests, without hurting performance. We even have #881 from @Malmahrouqi3 to benchmark on Frontier as well. This is great.

I've noticed in my own experimentation, plus reviewing these PRs, that my biggest concern is that we just don't have enough tests. A lot of code is untouched by the test suite. Codecov is not the perfect tool here, because it has a little trouble parsing fypp -> f90, so it marks some lines as not covered that are actually covered. Still, there are things like the output files, the probes, data transfer between simulation -> post_process, and so on. 

The code is not so hard to refactor, but there are some areas that are concerning. I suspect that #914 is a side effect of me or someone else's PR (I could be wrong). This case simply wasn't tested in CI appropriately.

There is a tango required to get decent tests without overfitting to specific computers or spending 10 hours in CI running (plus another 10 hours queuing in some cases). But I would rather have good tests so we can more confidently refactor and add features than be cavalier about merging quite important changes into the code. 

An example is #907 from @XZTian64 or #855 (and similar) from @Malmahrouqi3 and #901 from me. I'm not fully confident that nothing will go wrong in merging these, despite the tests. The ones that involve writing probes or post_process are most concerning at the moment, I think.

summary.otherNotes: Code coverage is currently at 50% and there are lines of code not covered by the test suite. One idea to address this is using a fuzzer across inputs to ensure initial conditions are valid.

Hello @b8zhong ,

I'm very interested and would like to do the implementation to support a model. What model do you suggest for starters ? And is there a way to get assigned?

Thanks !!!

> Hello [@b8zhong](https://github.com/b8zhong) ,
> 
> I'm very interested and would like to do the implementation to support a model. What model do you suggest for starters ? And is there a way to get assigned?
> 
> Thanks !!!

issueDTO.title: Remove dead code
issueDTO.description:
### Requirement

Remove dead code from the repository

### Proposal

Use official `deadcode` tool to identify unused code https://mfbmina.dev/en/posts/golang-deadcode/. It currently lists quite a few functions and packages.

### Recommended process

1. Run deadcode tool and pick ONE package to focus on.
2. Post a comment to this issue stating which package you're working on
3. Do not just delete the package / function, do some research first
   * find where (which PR) the function was introduced and what was using it & why
   * ideally find the PR in which that usage was removed without removing the function itself
   * post your findings in the comments to validate with maintainers that it's ok to delete
comments:
Hi @yurishkuro,

i have started with identification of unreachable functions with deadcode.
i am working on **cmd/ingester/** module and found out some deadcode but facing issues in pin pointing the related commit and PR.

Any help will be greatly appreciated.

Thanks!!

You can use git blame to show commits for specific lines, or git log to show history of the whole file. Sometimes files get moved so you may need to follow those moves. Once you have an interesting commit use git show to see more details and the pr number usually will be in the commit message.

Thanks,

Sure, I will leverage the information for further investigation.

Hi @yurishkuro 
I have been examining the `examples` package and found a function that is not in use https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/blob/cc7ea8d7fd5403c78e0a23db5c6bf06188c32546/examples/hotrod/pkg/pool/pool.go#L41

It was in introduced in pr [#40](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/40)
and was latest updated in pr [#1454](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/1454)

I am not able to find or get a clear indication where in the current codebase it was being used.

@AnmolxSingh this is because HotROD does not implement proper shutdown sequence, which should be invoked when the program receives a kill signal (other Jaeger binaries do trap the signal and perform shutdown)

Hi @yurishkuro 
while examining the `internal` package I found a function which might be a example of dead code.
https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/blob/f887e133cce1ffcbb4015868025f6bfd4c035764/internal/testutils/logger.go#L90

Just wanted to know is here to serve some purpose?
Introduced in pr [#198](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/198)

@AnmolxSingh I'd expect this function to be required by the API in the logging library. It doesn't mean our code would be invoking it directly. How else would the data be written to the buffer by the logging library?

Hi @yurishkuro,

While examining the codebase, I found that most of the functions identified as unused (dead code) are either:

- Used in `*_test.go` files, or
- Auto-generated by `thrift-0.9.2`.

Aside from those cases and the functions we've already discussed, I didn’t find any other obvious unused functions.

Please let me know if I am missing something.

Thanks!
hi @yurishkuro can i work on the cmd/collector/app/sanitizer module and investigating the function NewServiceNameSanitizer, which was reported as unreachable.

Hello @yurishkuro, I am new to this project and thought this is a good issue to start with.

I ran the deadcode tool as suggested and found the file `cmd\query\app\querysvc\query_service_test.go` has dead code in it. 

The functions that are identified as deadcode by the tool are: 

```
unreachable func: fakeStorageFactory1.Initialize
unreachable func: fakeStorageFactory1.CreateSpanReader
unreachable func: fakeStorageFactory1.CreateSpanWriter
unreachable func: fakeStorageFactory1.CreateDependencyReader
```

Upon investigating further I found out all of these functions were introduced in PR  [#1503 ](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/1503#ref-pullrequest-436336737) , [here](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/1503/commits/222851654e69566dfce26506866e3150ac364b66#diff-8f0bb159e943f0e3d69c11c0f8a6f9d7ac80d647fba0ed66b7132587a3664d93R264)

and the last PR i could find where major changes were made to this file is #6567, [here](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/commit/d7ab0f8c175956c1d36bbc2e18b34469f568e205#diff-8f0bb159e943f0e3d69c11c0f8a6f9d7ac80d647fba0ed66b7132587a3664d93R452)

Although I am not sure at what point these functions were used, It seems to me that `fakeStorageFactory1 `and its functions were likely introduced as part of early test scaffolding but were never integrated into actual test logic. Please correct me if I am wrong.

Please let me know if it is safe to remove these functions, and if I can open a PR regarding the same.

Thank you.

issueDTO.title: Forward and back fill of null and NaN values
issueDTO.description:
### Discussed in https://github.com/Eventual-Inc/Daft/discussions/4679
Originally posted by **mikeprince4** July 1, 2025 I see there's a `fill_null()` method, but it's unclear if it's possible to leverage this to get the same behavior as I would with a `pandas.fillna(method='ffill')`. Any ideas how to do this best?
# Feature Request The ability to fill null or NaN values based on the previous or next non-null/NaN value in the column. The API could look something like this, or by using a window function: ``` df = daft.from_pydict({"a": [1, None, 3]}) df.fill_null(strategy="forward").show() # should result in [1, 1, 3] df.fill_null(strategy="back").show() # should result in [1, 3, 3] ``` Related functions in other libraries: - [Pandas](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.fillna.html) - [Polars](https://docs.pola.rs/api/python/dev/reference/dataframe/api/polars.DataFrame.fill_null.html)

issueDTO.title: MOCO script uses `file_moco_params_csv` variable name for TSV file
issueDTO.description:
This issue lists a few possible improvements/fixes for [moco.py](https://github.com/neuropoly/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/048c0a5c4703c48ad1aab52838bf4200f3666101/spinalcordtoolbox/moco.py#L132) and [sct_dmri_moco.py](https://github.com/neuropoly/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/048c0a5c4703c48ad1aab52838bf4200f3666101/scripts/sct_dmri_moco.py) scripts which I encountered on during https://github.com/neuropoly/spinalcordtoolbox/pull/2664. I didn't want to extend original purpose of https://github.com/neuropoly/spinalcordtoolbox/pull/2664 PR, so points listed below can be solved in separate PR.

- [ ] `file_moco_params_csv` variable points to tsv file (`moco_params.tsv`):
https://github.com/neuropoly/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/048c0a5c4703c48ad1aab52838bf4200f3666101/spinalcordtoolbox/moco.py#L132
It is confusing. we can switch from `file_moco_params_csv` to `file_moco_params`. Or we can generally switch from tsv format to csv.

- [x] we should switch from `str` to `int` in arg parser in `sct_dmri_moco.py`, e.g. here:
https://github.com/neuropoly/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/048c0a5c4703c48ad1aab52838bf4200f3666101/scripts/sct_dmri_moco.py#L113
I briefly tested `int` instead of `str` but I got error. So I am not sure, if this parser (`from msct_parser import Parser`) supports `int`. We can consider to switch to `argparse`.
comments:
>  we should switch from str to int in arg parser in sct_dmri_moco.py, e.g. here:

we should just open a PR that will use argparse for all functions in SCT-- no need to open an issue to change to argparse *only* for dmri_moco--
Switch from `msct_parser` to `argparse` for `sct_dmri_moco.py` will be done in https://github.com/neuropoly/spinalcordtoolbox/pull/2819

issueDTO.title: bug(flags): Scheduling a new condition does not reset the rollout value
issueDTO.description:
### Bug Description

Saving a scheduled change to a feature flag has some confusing client-side behavior.

## How to reproduce

1. Navigate to a feature flag
2. Click on the Schedule Tab
3. Schedule a new condition
4. Click Schedule.

Expected: The schedule to be added and the rollout % to be cleared.
Actual: The rollout % is the same, but now we show a confusing error that the user needs to set the rollout % value

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6196e7cb-a9f5-453e-b5f4-fc71580d9619)


### Debug info

```shell
- [ ] PostHog Cloud, Debug information: [please copy/paste from https://us.posthog.com/settings/project-details#variables or https://eu.posthog.com/settings/project-details#variables]
- [ ] PostHog Hobby self-hosted with `docker compose`, version/commit: [please provide]
- [ ] PostHog self-hosted with Kubernetes (deprecated, see [`Sunsetting Kubernetes support`](https://posthog.com/blog/sunsetting-helm-support-posthog)), version/commit: [please provide]
```
comments:
I created a quick prototype to propose a UX fix for this issue.

**Prototype:**  

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0640b28f-308f-4407-ae43-2d228fee5437

---

### Problem

After scheduling a rollout (e.g. 20% in 17 days), the original rollout % input in the **Overview** tab stays active. This causes:

- Confusing validation errors
- Two conflicting rollout sources
- A broken mental model

---

### Proposed Fix (shown in the prototype)

1. User adds a scheduled rollout via the **Schedule** tab.
2. Only after selecting a date and time, the release condition fields appear (progressive disclosure).
3. The **Overview** tab updates to clearly show the scheduled rollout date and percentage.

This makes the state clear, avoids user errors, and reinforces the schedule as the single source of truth.

Let me know your thoughts! Happy to refine it!

I like it! However, we don't allow editing a schedule. So after you click "Schedule", we should probably reset the state of the form so a person can schedule their next change should they so choose. Keeping the rollout field around is confusing.

repository.description: 🦔 PostHog provides open-source web & product analytics, session recording, feature flagging and A/B testing that you can self-host. Get started - free.
repository.name: posthog

summary.main: Saving a scheduled change to a feature flag has some confusing client-side behavior. The rollout percentage is not cleared, and the user is shown a confusing error that the rollout percentage value needs to be set.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is related to the client-side behavior of scheduling a new condition in a feature flag, which does not reset the rollout value.
summary.attemptedFixes: The proposed fix includes progressive disclosure of release condition fields after selecting a date and time, and updating the Overview tab to show the scheduled rollout date and percentage.
summary.otherNotes: The user created a prototype to propose a UX fix for this issue. The prototype shows a new rollout percentage input field after scheduling a rollout, which makes the state clear and avoids user errors.

issueDTO.title: How Do I Get Merge Request Commits After the First Page?
issueDTO.description:
The merge request commits API does not allow any options, but it seems that any commits after the first 20 are thrown out. Interestingly, the request still takes a longer time if there are more commits in the merge request.

For example, say I have a project called "my/project", and the first merge request on that project has more than 20 commits If I call `Gitlab.client.merge_request_commits("my/project", 1).count`, I get "20" as the result.

How do I get merge request commits after the first 20?
comments: Unfortunately, this method currently doesn't support pagination using the `page` and `per_page` options. PRs are welcome.

issueDTO.title: Option to delete secret when build_key_vault_name is supplied
issueDTO.description:
<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

#### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or other comments that do not add relevant new information or questions, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

Please search the existing issues for relevant feature requests, and use the
reaction feature
(https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/)
to add upvotes to pre-existing requests.

#### Description

When using a key vault not created by packer, using build_key_vault_name, the secret created by packer is reused and new versions are added. The version is never disabled and the secret is not removed at the end of the packer run though and this has implication if the key vault is being backed up (500 version limit on backups and performance impacts).

It would be nice to have an option to delete the secret at the end to avoid the potential for hitting the limit and to avoid the performance impact that their documentation notes.

#### Use Case(s)

Allow for meeting company policy dictating key vault security and backup requirements without impact.

#### Potential configuration

```
build_key_vault_secret_delete = true 
```

#### Potential References
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/general/service-limits#backup-keys-secrets-certificates
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/general/service-limits#limits-on-count-of-keys-secrets-and-certificates
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/keyvault/secrets/delete-secret/delete-secret?view=rest-keyvault-secrets-7.4&tabs=HTTP

The version is never disabled and the secret is not removed at the end of the packer run, which has implications if the key vault is being backed up (500 version limit on backups and performance impacts). It would be nice to have an option to delete the secret at the end to avoid the potential for hitting the limit and to avoid the performance impact.
summary.validationOrRequirement: build_key_vault_secret_delete = true

summary.otherNotes: Community Note: Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request.

issueDTO.title: Add "Rename" Button for Preset Management with Popup Modal
issueDTO.description:
Add "Rename" Button for Preset Management with Popup Modal

**Description:**
We need to add a "Rename" button between the ComboBox (for selecting presets) and the "Delete" button. When clicked, this button should open a popup modal asking the user to enter a new name for the selected preset. Upon confirming, the preset's name should be updated in the object (`presets.name`) and the associated file. The previous file with the old name should be deleted.

**Tasks:**

1. **Add the "Rename" button:**
   - Place the "Rename" button between the ComboBox (preset selector) and the "Delete" button.
   - Ensure the button is clearly labeled and fits within the existing layout.

2. **Implement the popup modal:**
   - Create a modal that appears when the "Rename" button is clicked.
   - The modal should include:
     - An input field for the new preset name.
     - "Confirm" and "Cancel" buttons.
   - The "Confirm" button should only be enabled if the input field is not empty.

3. **Handle renaming logic:**
   - Update the `presets.name` property with the new name when the user clicks "Confirm".
   - Rename the corresponding preset file to match the new name and delete the old file.
   - Ensure the file renaming is done safely, checking for any name conflicts or invalid characters.

4. **Update the ComboBox selection and display:**
   - Refresh the ComboBox options to reflect the updated preset name.
   - Maintain the current selection in the ComboBox with the new name after renaming.

5. **Test the renaming functionality:**
   - Verify that the "Rename" button opens the modal correctly.
   - Test renaming with various inputs (valid, invalid, empty, conflicting names).
   - Confirm that the file is renamed correctly and the old file is deleted.
   - Ensure the ComboBox updates to reflect the new name without issues.

6. **Update documentation:**
   - Document the new "Rename" functionality.
   - Update any relevant sections of the user guide to explain how to rename presets.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The "Rename" button appears between the ComboBox and "Delete" button and functions as intended.
- The popup modal asks the user for a new name, and the "Confirm" button only works when a valid name is provided.
- The preset's name is updated both in the object (`presets.name`) and the corresponding file.
- The previous file is deleted after renaming.
- The ComboBox correctly displays the updated preset name.
- Documentation is updated to reflect the new feature.

**Additional Context:**
- The project uses ImGui, and the modal should integrate seamlessly with the existing UI.
- Ensure that renaming presets does not interfere with other functionalities like saving, loading, or deleting presets.
comments: May the gods be with me to take on this. Or was it done?

Hi @blessingmwiti , it's not yet implemented (as not many user has requested the feature). But, we're moving to tauri (for the ui, other stuff like inference and server stay the same) to properly support other labguages fonts and easier crossplatform management. Instead, we're actively working on [kolosal cli](https://github.com/kolosalai/kolosal-cli) with all the features with the desktop app, but run on terminal while waiting us to launch the tauri based app.

issueDTO.title: Placeholders must begin with one of the following "@", ":" or "%"
issueDTO.description:
### Task Description

We have some legacy `!` placeholders, and these are no longer valid.

> The Drupal 7 !variable, which inserts your value exactly as is, without running any sanitization functions, was deprecated. Use :variable instead.

Example error that came from
https://github.com/tripal/tripal/blob/9797278ceb7eeb040bd125c3d13d3e695219be83/tripal_chado/src/Plugin/TripalImporter/OBOImporter.php#L1323-L1324
`Placeholders must begin with one of the following "@", ":" or "%", invalid placeholder (!id) with string: "Did not get a response from EBI OLS trying to lookup ontology: !id"`

We aren't supposed to call `t()` for exceptions either 🙈

    369     else:
--> 370         raise ValueError(f"Unsupported pipeline type: {p}")
    371 
    372     def query_huggingface_inference_endpoints(*data):

ValueError: Unsupported pipeline type: image-text-to-text

### Have you searched existing issues?  🔎

### Reproduction

```python
import gradio as gr

gr.load("models/meta-llama/Llama-3.2-90B-Vision-Instruct").launch()
```

issueDTO.title: AIP-82: Add common messaging system providers
issueDTO.description:
### Body

related:  #49938

## Why

Several users have pointed out that the Event-Driven Scheduling feature introduced in Airflow 3 currently supports only Amazon SQS.

So I add Kafka common message queue provider in #49938, but there are still quite a few common providers that should be useful for airflow users to implement Event-Driven workflows.

## What

Here are some common messaging systems:

- [ ] Google PubSub
- [x] Amazon SQS
- [ ] Azure Message Bus
- [x] Apache Kafka
- [ ] Redis

reference for implementation: https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/49938/files

### Committer

- [x] I acknowledge that I am a maintainer/committer of the Apache Airflow project.
comments: Hi, may I try the pubsub one?
Hi, I would like to try the Redis one. Thanks!
hi, could I implement the "Azure Message Bus" one? thanks :)
Thanks all for making event-driven scheduling feature better!
Love it 👀

repository.name: airflow

- [ ] Google PubSub
- [x] Amazon SQS
- [ ] Azure Message Bus
- [x] Apache Kafka
- [ ] Redis
summary.attemptedFixes: Add Kafka common message queue provider in #49938
summary.otherNotes: Several users have pointed out that the Event-Driven Scheduling feature introduced in Airflow 3 currently supports only Amazon SQS.

issueDTO.title: [AOTI] Unit test for testing load_state_dict and
issueDTO.description:
### 🚀 The feature, motivation and pitch

I want to add a unit test for AOTI testing if user_managed weights works with load_state_dict.

It can follow a similar test https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/main/test/inductor/test_aot_inductor.py#L5733-L5835, but the new test is supposed to be simpler. 

User managed is the last bool passed into update_constant_buffer:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/d5d14ee823e70224a154884a5c2912643d648094/torch/_C/_aoti.pyi#L28

# Motivation:

AOTI will take in an eager (i.e. un-compiled)model and spit out a AOTI Model that is compiled. update_constant_buffer is an api to update the weights of such model. If we set user_managed=True, the new weights that we are passing in should just point to the tensors (i.e. no copy is done). So ideally, if we update the tensors we passed it, the changes should reflect on the AOTI model. This is already tested in test_update_user_managed_buffer.

What I want to see tested is if we:
1. pass in the model weights to AOTI model with user managed
2. Update the eager model weights with load_state_dict
3. Check if the update is reflected on the AOTI model.

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

cc @chauhang @penguinwu @avikchaudhuri @gmagogsfm @zhxchen17 @tugsbayasgalan @angelayi @suo @ydwu4 @desertfire @chenyang78 @yushangdi @benjaminglass1
comments: Working on this

issueDTO.title: Optionally support crane/docker style auth for greater compatibility
issueDTO.description:
### What is the version of your ORAS CLI

main

### What would you like to be added?

I would like a flag called `--simple-auth`.  If the flag is not present then the existing behavior is used.  Specifically creating a single `auth.newCache()` and used for all targets (source and destination).   If the flag is present then a new `auth.NewSingleContextCache()` ([definition](https://github.com/oras-project/oras-go/blob/c34d275e1ae7d6f2e017e72e0ff88b5525118640/registry/remote/auth/cache.go#L222)) is created for each target (source and destination).

### Why is this needed for ORAS?

See this [issue](https://github.com/oras-project/oras-go/issues/650) for the details.

### Are you willing to submit PRs to contribute to this feature?

- [ ] Yes, I am willing to implement it.

When viewing the JSON logs of `argocd-repo-server` in Loki there is a huge binary printed in `&runtime.RawExtension{Raw`. I have truncated the output, but it is flooding the logs and filling up the storage. 


time="2024-05-21T20:37:31Z" level=info msg="manifest cache hit: &ApplicationSource{RepoURL:registry-1.docker.io,Path:,TargetRevision:8.23.4,Helm:&ApplicationSourceHelm{ValueFiles:[],Parameters:[]HelmParameter{},ReleaseName:,Values:,FileParameters:[]HelmFileParameter{},Version:,PassCredentials:false,IgnoreMissingValueFiles:false,SkipCrds:false,ValuesObject:&runtime.RawExtension{Raw:*[123 34 ...],},},Kustomize:nil,Directory:nil,Plugin:nil,Chart:bitnamicharts/kube-prometheus,Ref:,}/8.23.4"


**To Reproduce**

Deploy ArgoCD to Kubernetes cluster and view the logs through [Loki](https://grafana.com/oss/loki/).

v2.11.1+9f40df0

issueDTO.title: Use application icon in push notification messages
issueDTO.description:
# Checklist

- [x] I have used the search function to see if someone else has already submitted the same bug report.*
- [x] I will describe the problem with as much detail as possible.*

# App

K-9 Mail

# App version

`8.2`

# Where did you get the app from?

F-Droid

# Android version

`12`

# Description

The current icon displayed on the status bar when K9 is checking for emails on the background is a bell, as shown in the figures below:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3fc47294-7668-4ab9-9ab7-38f0df030fea)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b4f2b037-411c-4297-bc75-50b20bae038a)

It's a rather generic icon, more suited to an alarm app than an email client.

Using K9's [own](https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/blob/3fd6f809fc0e3102bbf553c4d0d6a6b34cdd8efb/images/drawable-src/ic_notify_new_mail__legacy.svg) icon would make it clear what is actually running:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/236e1eb2-df4a-4823-ac76-404182765d58)
comments: I think that makes sense, using some variant of the app icon. We'll have to use an icon that works with the specs required for notification icons. When someone works on this please let us know what size and specs you need and we'll create one or point it out. I believe there are some more specific requirements to make it align and fit in well. There will likely be some refactoring necessary so that each app can use its own icon. This is a good starting point: https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/blob/f258538ba0fb4a4c34ad35bdd5d95abf60472c97/legacy/common/src/main/java/com/fsck/k9/resources/K9CoreResourceProvider.kt#L38 For reference here is what it looks zoomed out on my device:
Please use a similar mechanism as the `AppNameProvider` and `BrandNameProvider` to allow different icons per app.

I would like to work on this. The icon needed for this should be a 24x24 dp Vector Drawable. Android will automatically scale it to fit the screen, ensuring that it adapts to different screen densities. It should be pure White with a transparent background.
Hey, apologies but we promised this one to @sttapollo already in chat. Would you mind taking one of the other issues?

Hi @kewisch this is what I noticed so far, please lmk if I am off here

- In K-9 Mail, iconPushNotification (from K9CoreResourceProvider) is used for the foreground push service.
- In Thunderbird, I see iconCheckingMail (from NotificationResourceProvider) used in SyncNotificationController when background sync runs. This seems like the equivalent of K-9’s iconPushNotification.

Would like to confirm:

- Is iconCheckingMail the intended equivalent push/sync icon in Thunderbird?
- If so, would it make sense to unify this across both apps via something like a NotificationIconProvider interface? (Sticking to the mechanism wmontwe mentioned above)
- Do we want to update the icon in Thunderbird too? (Before I proceed to ask for assets)

Also, please assign this ticket to me 😅

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d0755ddd-43f5-496b-af6f-8597eccd8f54)

Apologies for the delay. @wmontwe do you have more info here on the technical bits re iconCheckingMail/iconPushNotification ? I kind of would have expected that the same icon is used on both apps. 

Either way, I think we should use the respective app icon in both apps, and using a NotificationIconProvider makes sense for that. Thanks for looking into this!

@kewisch We need to make a decision on whether to use a generic icon or the monochrome app icon. If we choose to use the app icon, it should be provided with a similar mechanism as the `AppNameProvider`. Alternatively, using the simplest approach would be to retrieve the icon from [Material Icons](https://fonts.google.com/icons).

I don't have a preference between monochrome and generic icon, I think this is something @SttApollo could ask the design folks. Using a Material icon I think was what we're trying to avoid in the first place, aiming for the app icon instead. Or am I misunderstanding?

@SttApollo do you have everything you need to reach out to design?
yes @kewisch - I'll reach out to them shortly!

Hello @SttApollo We should be using the app icon in the top left corner on any notification card show in the notifications area or lock screen. Do you need the K-9 logo or TB logo formatted? Or can you pull from what we're using in the app currently?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a9c63b88-1cd3-48ac-b55b-6f77da85b9c4)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bb652794-179c-43c4-8846-4da8eb8b7226)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d671cbe0-c28f-44b4-9996-5f16c3b80d8b)  Hi @laurelterlesky  — for the Android notifications (lock screen, status bar, and left side of the notification card), it looks like we need a monochrome white logo with a transparent background in the form of a 24x24dp vector drawable.

I manually updated the black version of the logo to white to test the logic I’ve implemented, and it seems to be working as expected. Would you be able to provide a proper version of the icon? Once that’s in place, I can finalize the logic and move forward with the PR.
@laurelterlesky What do you think of my comments above?
Sure. Will see if we have one of file, otherwise we'll build one.
@laurelterlesky any luck?

### Discussed in https://github.com/orgs/supabase/discussions/27425
Originally posted by **askkaz** June 20, 2024 We have walked a lot of Supabase users through setting up their auth emails and it is frequently a source of confusion that this button: sends the "Confirm signup" template if the user has not yet confirmed their email and not the "Magic Link" template. I think it would help users getting started if the initial menu was context aware enough to display the correct option ("confirm signup"). bonus nit - template names should match, see "password recovery" vs. "reset password" double bonus nit - email template tab names should all match casing ("Confirm signup" vs "Magic Link")

issueDTO.title: Targetable Broadcast Messages, via ID - `broadcast ?i[id] r[message]`
issueDTO.description:
Modify the existing broadcast message - currently used for map announcements - to allow the display of important messages to a specific player, instead of the whole server.

Current command implementation:
```
broadcast r[message]
```

Preferred command implementation:
```
broadcast ?i[id] r[message]
```

Appropriate command usage:
```
broadcast New map <name> by <author> released on <difficulty>.
broadcast 23 WARNING: Continued blocking will result in a 1-day ban. Please, go Race/Playground.
```

## Motives
A great tool for moderation, with significant potential for making messages noticed and taken more seriously.

The community is currently under a lot of activity related to race-blocking. A feature like this would allow us to efficiently send a warning to one or more players, which would then justify us to take actions with more confidence and with a longer punishment time.

With the current solutions, there's no effective way of communicating with the player in a way that proves, without denial, that we are authenticated as a moderator. Currently, players may ignore chat messages or even completely disable the chat, which would make any form of communication hopeless. A form of communication like this would be important before taking more aggressive actions, such as kicking or banning.

A feature like this would allow us to scare most players who aren't fully aware of the consequences. Allowing us to send a message to a group of players, regardless of whether they are blocking or not, without consequences. This can be applied in chaotic cases that casual methods of moderation wouldn't be feasible, such as in Linear and Multeasymap servers.
comments: `broadcast ?i[id] r[message]` wouldn't be backwards compatible with the previous usage, so I suppose it should be a separate command `broadcast_id` or `broadcast_target` instead.
If server backward-compatibility is important, then yeah, I would see `broadcast_id i[id] r[message]` to be more appropriate.
I think this would be a good feature, and also a decent first issue IMO, since it would mostly just be copying `ConBroadcast`.
