issueDTO.title: [ISSUE] RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET does not allow you to reference a differently-named k8s Secret
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the issue:**

In https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/issues/644

we wanted to define a configuration that would use existingSecret for all components. one set of `secretKeyRef`'s in the webmodeler restapi appears to not have a configurable secret name.

https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/blob/e9ffb23292a0a3886cb4612a0e09d594dc7d32d4/charts/camunda-platform-latest/templates/web-modeler/deployment-restapi.yaml#L54-L68


A workaround to this would be to set 

```yaml
webModeler:
  restapi:
    env:
      - name: RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET
        valueFrom:
          secretKeyRef:
            name: name-of-different-secret
            key: pusher-app-secret
```

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the issue is. -->

**Actual behavior:**

RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET uses RELEASE-web-modeler for the secret name regardless of whether all existingSecrets are defined explicitly.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happens. -->

**Expected behavior:**

I expect that I can reference a Secret for any references of `secretKeyRef`. 

This feature should be implemented for only 8.8. For 8.7 the workaround should be used.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

**How to reproduce:**

<!--
Steps to reproduce the issue.

If possible add a minimal reproducer code sample in a new repo/branch.
-->

**Logs:**

<!-- If possible add the full logs related to the issue. -->

**Environment:**

**Please note: Without the following info, it's hard to resolve the issue and probably it will be closed.**

- Platform: <!-- [e.g. GCP, AWS, etc] -->
- Helm CLI version: <!-- [e.g. 3.10.0] -->
- Chart version: <!-- [e.g. 8.x.x] -->
- Values file: <!-- [e.g. include or link to your values file] -->
comments:
This is related to 
#1898 and #2277   and overall product-hub ticket https://github.com/camunda/product-hub/issues/2312

Hi @jessesimpson36, have you tested this with CHC 10.3.2?  It did not work for me:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/080ceb23-faae-4da9-94d0-d06ecd9e164d)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6f8fc825-84e9-4451-a081-44bc94207f4e)

You are referencing the `kubectl describe` information, which doesn't properly display duplicate environment variables. I would suggest testing the functionality, or exec'ing into the pod to see what environment variable you actually have referenced.

But I admit I have  not yet  tested this workaround.

I created a secret with 

```
kubectl  create secret generic --from-literal pusher-app-secret=jesseishacker name-of-different-secret
```
and exec'd into the restapi pod and confirmed the env var is set properly.
```
~ $ env | grep PUSHER
RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET=jesseishacker
```

I have now tested the workaround.

Confirmed the alternate solution in 10.3.2 using:
```
webModeler:
  restapi:
    env:
      - name: RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET
        valueFrom:
          secretKeyRef:
            name: name-of-different-secret
            key: pusher-app-secret
```

https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/blob/main/charts/camunda-platform-8.6/templates/web-modeler/configmap-shared.yaml#L10
`  pusher-app-key: {{ randAlphaNum 20 }}`
https://github.com/camunda/camunda-platform-helm/blob/main/charts/camunda-platform-8.6/templates/web-modeler/secret-shared.yaml#L10
`  pusher-app-secret: {{ randAlphaNum 20 | b64enc }}`

Due to the way this is currently implemented, it is always creating a diff during dry-run and what is worse, it can cause components to go out of sync if one of them restarts and loads in new config while others still run on the old instance

repository.description: Camunda Platform 8 Self-Managed Helm charts
repository.name: camunda-platform-helm

summary.main: The RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET does not allow you to reference a differently-named k8s Secret, which is a requirement for using existingSecrets for all components.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET should be able to reference a differently-named k8s Secret.
summary.attemptedFixes:
The workaround is to set the RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET to reference a differently-named k8s Secret, as shown in the following YAML:

```yaml
webModeler:
  restapi:
    env:
      - name: RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET
        valueFrom:
          secretKeyRef:
            name: name-of-different-secret
            key: pusher-app-secret
```

This workaround has been tested and confirmed to work.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to #1898 and #2277, and overall product-hub ticket https://github.com/camunda/product-hub/issues/2312. The workaround to this issue is to set the RESTAPI_PUSHER_SECRET to reference a differently-named k8s Secret.

issueDTO.title: Update color page documentation based on Borealis color palette changes
issueDTO.description: Borealis introduced substantial changes to our color system in EUI. As part of the initiative, we updated the lists of colors in our docs to reflect the new system. However, I don't believe we updated the overall guidance and description of our new color system. ## The goal of this task is to: 1. Review the current copy on our color pages to ensure it reflects the reality of our new color system 2. Ensure we are providing helpful guidance around how and when to apply colors. ## Additional Context: These are the two pages that we should focus on: https://eui.elastic.co/#/theming/colors/values https://eui.elastic.co/#/utilities/color-palettes Specifically, these are some thoughts that jump out to me: I'm unsure whether or not the text is accurate / helpful. The math doesn't add up on this one -- this is describing a palette of 6 colors. And do we still call them "Brand colors"? Many colors included could use a description. How and when should colors be applied. I suspect we could use this for all color tokens we have included. We include deprecated colors in our documentation. I suspect we should just remove these. We don't say it explicitly, but I'm fairly certain we do **not** want people to use these colors for anything other than data visualization. Maybe this is a topic for another issue, but for the color palettes page, it's never been quite clear to me when and how we expect folks to use these colors.
comments: Hey @ryankeairns, not sure who's project to put this in at this point, so I put it in both the EUI project and Design System project for input.

re: projects, that works
I'll chat with @ek-so , and we can prioritize in our design backlog.

@ryankeairns @ek-so Do you think we could bump this up in priority? Even if it's just an hour or two time boxed effort to try to review and update our color docs to align better with "[WIP][EUI Guidelines] Working with colors" would be a big win, I think.
This would be a good first issue for our new designer. Labeled as such.

@JoseLuisGJ @ryankeairns 

Here's another example, I recently saw that we issued the following deprecation:

> Deprecated `euiPaletteForLightBackground` and `euiPaletteForDarkBackground` palettes. Use the newly added data vis color tokens instead.

The funny thing is, when I looked back at our documentation, I couldn't find it actually documented anywhere. So my hunch is that it wasn't documented? I wonder how much of that exists.

Honestly, I still don't quite understand the relation between our color palettes and color tokens, when to use which, and what tokens map to which palettes.

TL;DR - I agree, we need to have a stronger, clearer stance on this topic.

Roughly speaking, what we see today is essentially the results of progressing from not having proper tokens to having them.
- In the 'olden days', `euiPalette*` was a convenient way to obtain (or create on the fly!) an array of colors.
- Now, we have tokens - colors specified with intent - and a naming convention that gets to the same result... a set(s) of colors _for data viz_

Where things got muddied is that these palettes were used sorta like faux tokens. Out of convenience, people began plucking out values and using them in non-dataviz use cases.

This topic will inevitably lead toward _"Do we still need the palettes then?"_
- I would hash that out with the data viz experts.
- Note that these palettes are also exposed to users when building visualizations so, in that regard, we may need to keep the component but be more restrictive on its use and guidelines.

issueDTO.title: Success stories improvements
issueDTO.description:
### What is the problem or limitation you are having?

I started to proofread the [success stories](https://toga.readthedocs.io/en/stable/background/project/success.html), then I thought... Why not reformat this to make it more consistent and informative?

### Describe the solution you'd like

 I'm envisioning a table, listing the same info for each app:

- Name (which links to the app, as currently)
- Perhaps a small screenshot
- Brief description of what it does
- Platform(s) supported

Also, we currently have one page for Briefcase and one for Toga; they have some apps in common and some unique, and there's no mechanism to sync these. Considering how often people ask about examples, I think it might make more sense to put one combined page on the main site, and potentially link to it from both docs. It would also then make sense, I imagine, to add a column for "BeeWare component(s) used". 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We could still maintain separate pages, but I'm not sure if there's a good way to make sure they stay in sync with each other. It's also not clear, currently, from just looking at one, which of the apps also use the other.

If we do keep the individual pages, it seems redundant to mention that each app uses the tech in question.

### Additional context

_No response_
comments: Yes, that all sounds good.

**Describe the bug**
After installation and executing a first verification, we can see that report are not available, specially when we should go to emba_logs
Even thought they are available inside the server, they are not available via the web-browser. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. EMBArk installation (default mode/docker-mode)
2. Start EMBArk: sudo ./run-server.sh
3. Run analysis
4. Try to read logs
5. See error

_Not Found
The requested resource was not found on this server._

**Expected behavior**
Open reports
comments:
Thank you for contributing an issue!

**Welcome to the EMBA firmware analysis community!**

We are glad you are here and appreciate your contribution. Please keep in mind our contributing guidelines [here](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [here](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/blob/master/CONTRIBUTORS.md).
Also, please check [existing open issues](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/issues) and consider to open a discussion in the dedicated [discussion area](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/discussions).
Additionally, we have collected a lot of details around EMBArk, the installation and the usage of EMBArk in our [Wiki](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/wiki).

If you like _EMBA_ you have the chance to support us by becoming a [Sponsor](https://github.com/sponsors/e-m-b-a) or buying some beer [here](https://www.buymeacoffee.com/securefirmware).

This is an automatic message. Allow for time for the EMBA community to be able to read the issue and comment on it.

Hi,

I'm guessing you're seeing something like this:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d8fdbfe3-0c8b-4bc0-8865-05600b125283)

EMBArk has some access restrictions that are based on user and group permission.
My first guess is you tried to access a report that isn't yours and you're not in the same user-group/team.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5aba4352-2d1a-4876-8669-a40d0dbce8ba)

Sharing reports with other users is only possible if you are in the same group or you are staff member/admin.
(For single user setups I would recommend setting up / using the admin account)

Should this not apply to your situation I will need further information on:
1. what firmware you tested
2. what does the embarl.local/dashboard/report/ show
3. what do the logs say

I will detail the step by step as done previously on other builds: (eg v1 and v2)

1) Install as follows git clone https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark.git; cd embark; sudo ./installer.sh -d
2) run with ./run-server
3) Since I am not able to resolve emba.local, I enter with local IP address eg: http://172.18.20.250
4) Upload a new FW for analysis. I believe it can be any file anyway. 
5) Analysis is executed (for this information here I push only SBOM analysis to be fast)
6) We see analysis on going. 
7) When it is finished, we try to see final report:

drwxr-xr-x  3 www-embark sudo 4.0K Jul  2 16:31 ed594152-648e-4caa-92ec-85402edca29d

issueDTO.title: Allow directly opening files/folders instead of containing folder in tray search
issueDTO.description:
<!--- Please keep this note for other contributors -->

### How to use GitHub

* Please use the 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are interested into the same feature.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

---

## Feature request

**Which Nextcloud Version are you currently using:** (see administration page)
3.15.3 Windows version.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I have a folder containing a lot of folders with similar names that I need to manually sort and look through so I would like to search them. I disabled Windows search indexing on my Nextcloud directory because windows kept on downloading files I wanted to only keep online every time I searched for something in the parent folder.

The search function in the Nextcloud tray menu is able to find the desired sub folder, but clicking the folder only opens the containing folder and not the folder itself. This is useless to me because, as said, there are a lot of different folders and the folder names are too similar.

It looks like Nextcloud just opens the containing folder for folders or files. It would be nice if there was at least a context open to allow opening folder or files.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Open folder or file by default and have open containing folder the context menu option, but that risks messing with other people's workflow since open containing folder is the current behavior.
comments: Thanks for the feedback, we will look into improving this.

Currently this feature works as @mijioij wants it to work (as far as I am aware of).

My folders are structured as follows
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cce6c3a6-96a0-408d-a99e-1a78aa013608)

And when I search I get
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57c1c6ec-cfed-40be-a3a4-ef00c73cca89)

Upon clicking I am redirected into the folder I clicked on
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd7ccc4f-1edd-4e7b-8893-71def69ec3f2)

Is this how you (@mijioij) wanted it to be? Or did I misunderstand?

@mike0609king That isn't the location in the tray I am talking about. It's the search results after searching an item with the tray menu's search function, not the folder listing under the standard file sync in the tray menu settings. 

Side note: When I click a folder under the standard file sync tab, it opens in windows explorer and doesn't open a browser like your example suggests.
@mijioij I am not sure what you mean in that case. Could you show me a screenshot?

@mijioij Thanks for the quick response. I am sure, that I use the same search tray above. Maybe it has been fixed on the current version. Which version are you using? 

EDIT: I will also try it out again and take a look at the code for this.

@mike0609king The pictures you showed are only when you right click tray icon -> settings. I got to the screenshot I showed when I right click the tray icon -> Open main dialog -> enter search term in the search box and search.

I am using version 3.16.6 stable.

issueDTO.title: Silent failure when routing can't be completed
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
When submitting an invoice to be paid when completing an order, if the route can't be completed due to a low PPM, the API will return a 400 with the correct error message. However, the page doesn't do anything outside of stopping the spinner to show the request finished. No error message is shown to direct me to how to fix the issue.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Take an offer
2. Send the collateral
3. Attempt to submit an invoice with a small PPM to force failure
4. Notice no message comes up
5. Check the dev console and look at the failed call in the Network tab.
6. Cry a little

**Expected behavior**
I expected that a failure would show a toast or something to tell me how to fix the problem. The message returned from the API has the information I would need. It just should be surfaced in the UI so I don't have to go looking through the Network tab to find the solution.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: PopOS
 - Browser: Tor Browser
 - Version: 14.5.4

issueDTO.title: ENH Add `pos_label` parameter to `TargetEncoder`
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the workflow you want to enable

Add a `pos_label` parameter to `TargetEncoder` to enable the user to specify which label should be the positive class when the target is binary.

### Describe your proposed solution

Add a `pos_label` parameter that is passed to the `LabelBinarizer` `pos_label` parameter.

### Describe alternatives you've considered, if relevant

_No response_

### Additional context

Ref: https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/pull/26674#discussion_r1317446826

cc @ogrisel
comments:
Indeed, it makes sense. I am also thinking that the current validation of `LabelBinarizer` is not support UX friendly since it accepts only `Integral` values. I assume that we should be able to pass any type of classes.

Then we could use the `_check_pos_label_consistency` and improve it as well by passing `classes` if already computed (to avoid calling `np.unique`) and also add an extra check that `pos_label` is in `classes`.
/take

Hi @ivantishchenko, just checking in to see if you're still working on this issue. If not, I'd be happy to take it over or collaborate if you're open to it. Let me know what works best — totally understand if you're busy or it's still in progress!

Thanks!

issueDTO.title: Custom expression should not be available to use in join condition
issueDTO.description: ### Describe the bug Custom column, expression, is available in join condition picker. Clicking it results in console error, while nothing is happening in the UI. Context in [this](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0645JP1W81/p1737473996582099) slack thread. ### To Reproduce Create a query is in the screenshot. You can pick the custom expression as column to compare in join condition. ### Expected behavior Custom column should not be available in aforementioned context. ### Logs _No response_ ### Information about your Metabase installation ```JSON 9c904e8500eba75d665b1189cf87c0af93e7db54 ``` ### Severity Confusing ### Additional context _No response_
comments:
We should tread somewhat carefully here. It's not clear how long this has been possible, and so there may be questions in the wild which make use of it.

Theoretically there's nothing wrong with using an expression in a join condition, but it won't compile correctly today.

The workaround if you do need a join based on an expression is to define the expression in a model or saved question, and then make that the source for another question that does the join.
I would prefer making this working, rather than removing it, but not as being able to choose a custom column, but rather being able to set the custom expression
But now it works all wrong, the custom column shown in the wrong dropdown:

I am linking this issue to a customer's ticket. My current understanding is that this bug will be resolved by making custom expressions work in joins rather than removing the ability to choose a custom column altogether. If I should create a separate feature request, let me know!

> I am linking this issue to a customer's ticket. My current understanding is that this bug will be resolved by making custom expressions work in joins rather than removing the ability to choose a custom column altogether. If I should create a separate feature request, let me know!

We will remove the possibility to pick custom columns in join conditions.
We'll add a way to use custom expressions in joins, but that's a separate feature, indeed.
Not sure what happens first though.
Got it, I'll refer to this FR instead. thanks! https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36470

repository.description: The easy-to-use open source Business Intelligence and Embedded Analytics tool that lets everyone work with data :bar_chart:
repository.name: metabase

summary.main: Custom column, expression, is available in join condition picker. Clicking it results in console error, while nothing is happening in the UI.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Custom column should not be available in aforementioned context.
summary.attemptedFixes:
We'll add a way to use custom expressions in joins, but that's a separate feature, indeed.
Not sure what happens first though.
summary.otherNotes:
We should tread somewhat carefully here. It's not clear how long this has been possible, and so there may be questions in the wild which make use of it.
Theoretically there's nothing wrong with using an expression in a join condition, but it won't compile correctly today.
The workaround if you do need a join based on an expression is to define the expression in a model or saved question, and then make that the source for another question that does the join.

summary.otherNotes: The issue is about the documentation of `onCreateUser` in Meteor. The problem is that the `_id` received in the hook is not the final `_id` of the user, but a provisional one that will be overwritten.

issueDTO.title: Milkshakes and other milk-related crafts cause allergic reactions for the lactose intolerant when made from lactose-free ingredients
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98374042/193438239-6f0a7bf8-a2bf-4256-b86d-3ac15ef2f9dd.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98374042/193438275-48f9c921-75a4-414a-af86-a35b4dad0482.png)
Notice the soy milk used

### Steps to reproduce

Self-explanatory

### Expected behavior

Milk products should be lactose-free when made from lactose-free ingredients

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Versions and configuration

- OS: Windows
    - OS Version: 10.0.22000.318 (21H2)
- Game Version: 07a9641 [64-bit]
- Graphics Version: Tiles
- Game Language: English [en]
- Mods loaded: [
    Dark Days Ahead [dda],
    Disable NPC Needs [no_npc_food],
    No Fungal Growth [no_fungal_growth],
    Bionic Professions [package_bionic_professions]
]


### Additional context

_No response_
comments:
I can confirm that this bug is indeed happening as well on a fresh copy of 349262c. Provided are screenshots of sweetened fortified milk and coffee substitute with milk with the flags ALLERGEN_MILK. Both of which cause allergic reactions.
The issue seems that the recipes point to a singular item and must be separated to instead point to a lactose-free version to fix the issue.
![wrong2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66237588/194770529-fb405b7a-f510-4b73-96d9-65cf6e6fc137.PNG)
![Wrong](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66237588/194770526-4d813f9e-68c6-4600-b8e3-3e6fade326d5.PNG)

the first item is found in json\items\comestibles\drink.json
![Sweet milk](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202925376-272522f7-10b5-4f1c-86e7-77fd50aad9a1.PNG)
and json\recipes\food\drinks.json
![Sweet milk recipes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202925370-7b451780-4461-4512-9b1a-5cd438e54de1.PNG)
the second item also is found in json\items\comestibles\drink.json
![coffee Substitute](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202924849-aa511af1-7cbb-4c72-bce3-868309745c56.PNG)
and json\recipes\food\drinks.json
![coffee Substitute recipe](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202924940-2fd0fc78-c147-414b-b0ce-c08db97e096b.PNG)

But none of the entries have the flag ALLERGEN_MILK, however in json\items\comestibles\meatdishes.json, it is present. 
![Meat Dishes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202926229-6824cbc1-49c3-4539-b6fc-8820b7ddeef4.PNG)

Both of the drinks look to inherit properties from Milk however and when searching for the flag ALLERGEN_MILK we come across a few different entries that point to the milk ingredient.

In json\flags.json, we have the Flag for ALLERGEN_MILK

![Allergen Milk](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202925681-2d495eac-f304-4b09-bdb5-afcf02e0ad14.PNG)

also in src\consumption.cpp 
![Allergy type](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202926369-f8310442-350e-44e7-a535-7a1e5cd64fc7.PNG)
 
ALLERGEN_MILK is defined in flag.cpp
![Allergen Milk def cpp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202926519-ab34ef66-562a-4aaf-854d-58e842dfdeba.PNG)
and flag.h
![Allergen Milk def h](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202926525-3b4fe8c8-6626-4187-8bfb-ecd3bff56833.PNG)

and is added to milk with Item_factory::set_allergy_flags which is in item_factory.cpp
![Allergy flag set](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64069763/202926608-364e3e27-884a-4752-be23-9f8350d1980a.PNG)
So how should we solve this issue? The easiest way i agree would be to add new recipes, however this might come into issues later on on coding allergy/ allergy free foods

this is the commit that added the allergens to items
https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/commit/7d288376d6ba0beb41b05ac9c8ed5fa922a1657b

Not able to reproduce in current experimental. Though the recipe says a milk allergen warning, the final product does not contain milk and is drinkable by a lactose intolerant character.
Tested by crafting a variety of items. Pancakes, milkshakes, milktea, etc. utilizing almond milk.

issueDTO.title: Provide cache transaction methods that use CacheKeyInfo
issueDTO.description:
Related to discussion in #3478.

We should provide `readObject` methods on `ReadTransaction` that take in `CacheKeyInfo` instead of a stringly-typed key. This would ensure that typenames are prepended and formatted properly to cache keys and remove implicit knowledge the user must have.

issueDTO.title: [BUG] MaximumSurface requires surface_markers
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**

Running a FESTIM (v1.4) simulation with the `MaximumSurface` export produces the following error:
```
MaximumSurface.compute() missing 1 required positional argument: 'surface_markers'
``` 

A similar error arises with `MinimumSurface`. It seems that another if-clause should be added [here](https://github.com/festim-dev/FESTIM/blob/84905040764f87ebfdc9616779d3ed4735e2fbf0/festim/exports/derived_quantities/derived_quantities.py#L127-L143) to pass the `surface_markers`. 

**To Reproduce**

Run the MWE below:

```python
import festim as F
import numpy as np

model = F.Simulation()

model.materials = F.Material(id=1, D_0=1, E_D=0)

model.mesh = F.MeshFromVertices(np.linspace(0, 1, 10))

model.T = 1

model.settings = F.Settings(
    transient=True, absolute_tolerance=1e10, relative_tolerance=1e-10, final_time=1
)

model.dt = F.Stepsize(0.1)

model.exports = F.DerivedQuantities([F.MaximumSurface(field=0, surface=1)])

model.initialise()
model.run()

```
comments:
Additionally, `self.surface_markers` should be defined. 

Unfortunately, it didn't work for a 2D multi material problem with GMSH mesh as [here](https://github.com/KulaginVladimir/LID-validation/blob/main/LID/LID_2D.py)

In a multi material 2D problem, all similar classes do not work. Example of error:
```
  File "/mnt/pool/6/vvkulagin/FESTIM/miniconda3/envs/festim-env2/lib/python3.13/site-packages/festim/exports/derived_quantities/maximum_volume.py", line 61, in compute
    return np.max(self.function.vector().get_local()[subd_dofs])
                  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^
IndexError: index 132920 is out of bounds for axis 0 with size 132778
```

> In a multi material 2D problem, all similar classes do not work. Example of error:
> 
> ```
>   File "/mnt/pool/6/vvkulagin/FESTIM/miniconda3/envs/festim-env2/lib/python3.13/site-packages/festim/exports/derived_quantities/maximum_volume.py", line 61, in compute
>     return np.max(self.function.vector().get_local()[subd_dofs])
>                   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^
> IndexError: index 132920 is out of bounds for axis 0 with size 132778
> ```

This should be fixed by #981 

EDIT: got mixed up this is not related to FESTIM2

Example of parallel safe version using `dolfin`:
```python
from dolfin import *
import numpy as np

N = 10
mesh = UnitSquareMesh(N, N)
ff = MeshFunction("size_t", mesh, mesh.topology().dim() - 1, 0)


class Boundary(SubDomain):
    def inside(self, x, on_boundary):
        return on_boundary


Boundary().mark(ff, 1)
V = FunctionSpace(mesh, "CG", 1)
u = Function(V)
u.interpolate(Expression("sin(pi*x[0])*cos(x[1])*sin(pi*x[1])+x[0]", degree=2))

dm = V.dofmap()

facets = ff.where_equal(1)
entity_closure_dofs = np.array(
    dm.entity_closure_dofs(mesh, mesh.topology().dim() - 1, facets), dtype=np.int32
)
local_dofs = entity_closure_dofs < len(u.vector().get_local())
if len(local_dofs) == 0:
    local_max = -np.inf
else:
    local_max = np.max(u.vector().get_local()[entity_closure_dofs[local_dofs]])

global_max = MPI.max(mesh.mpi_comm(), local_max)

print(mesh.mpi_comm().rank, f"{local_max=}, {global_max=}")

File("u.pvd") << u

```

summary.main: The issue is that the `MaximumSurface` and `MinimumSurface` exports are not working correctly in a 2D multi-material problem with GMSH mesh. The error message indicates that the `surface_markers` argument is missing, but the problem persists even when this argument is provided.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The `MaximumSurface` and `MinimumSurface` exports require the `surface_markers` argument. This is a requirement for the exports to function correctly.
summary.attemptedFixes: A potential fix has been suggested, but it did not work for a 2D multi-material problem with GMSH mesh. The issue is still open and requires further investigation.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to the FESTIM simulation software and the `MaximumSurface` and `MinimumSurface` export features. The problem arises when running a simulation with these exports and the error message indicates that the `surface_markers` argument is missing. The issue has been reproduced locally and a potential fix has been suggested. However, the issue persists in a 2D multi-material problem with GMSH mesh. The problem is not specific to FESTIM2.

issueDTO.title: fix BINARY_SUBSCR to use __class_getitem__ as needed  (__getitem__() missing 1 required positional argument: 'idx' )
issueDTO.description:
*Note*: If you have a model or program that is not supported yet but should be, please use the program coverage template.

## 🐛 Bug

`InterpreterError: Encountered exception TypeError: SequenceWrapperMethods.__getitem__() missing 1 required positional argument: 'idx' while tracing `

### To Reproduce

```
def fn():
   return list[int]
thunder.jit(fn)()
```

fails.

### Additional context

The error is becauee the _binary_subscr_handler in thunder/core/interpreter.py always uses __getitem__ instead of __class_getitem__ when the tos1 is a type.

It would want a test along the lines of the above in test_interpreter.py .

The relevance is that Transformers 4.53 introduced something of that in the jitted codepath.

@tejapulagam if you want to work on this, please self-assign.

cc @lantiga
comments: I can work on this!

repository.description: Thunder gives you PyTorch models superpowers for training and inference. Unlock out-of-the-box optimizations for performance, memory and parallelism, or roll out your own.
repository.name: lightning-thunder

summary.main: Fix BINARY_SUBSCR to use __class_getitem__ as needed, as the current implementation is missing the 'idx' argument.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The error is caused by the missing required positional argument 'idx' in the __getitem__() function.
summary.attemptedFixes: It would want a test along the lines of the above in test_interpreter.py.
summary.otherNotes: The error is because the _binary_subscr_handler in thunder/core/interpreter.py always uses __getitem__ instead of __class_getitem__ when the tos1 is a type.

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Inconsistent behavior when prepending or appending to notes
issueDTO.description:
### Verified issue does not already exist?

- [x] I have searched and found no existing issue

### What happened?

If I append to a transaction's notes, Actual adds a space between the previous note and the added text. However, if I set up a rule to append to a note, no space is added between the note and added text. I'm ok with either behavior, but would prefer it to be consistent.

### How can we reproduce the issue?

Select a transaction, bulk edit note, prepend or append, type anything in. You will notice a space is placed in between the old and new text.

Create a rule (or just use the rule editor to bulk edit) that prepends or appends to a note, run it, you'll see that no space is added.

### Where are you hosting Actual?

Docker

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome, Firefox

### Operating System

Windows 11

issueDTO.title: DataFlex - add support for this language
issueDTO.description:
<!--

👋 If you have the time and know-how, send us a pull-request: everybody is welcome to contribute!
Otherwise, fill out the following fields as best you can.

-->
## Language name
DataFlex

## URL of example repository
https://github.com/DataFlexCode
https://github.com/NilsSve 

## URL of syntax highlighting grammar
https://docs.dataaccess.com/dataflexhelp/mergedProjects/LanguageGuide/Language_Guide.htm

## Most popular extensions
*.src,*.pkg,*.vw,*.dg,*.sl,*.bp,*.wo,*.inc
<!--

List the extensions commonly used by this language.
*.src,*.pkg,*.vw,*.dg,*.sl,*.bp,*.wo,*.inc

-->

## Detected language
DataFlex
<!--

What language are files for this language being identified as, if any?
DataFlex
-->
comments:
DataFlex uses a lot of different file extensions, some of which will likely have conflicts. Modern DataFlex uses a common workspace structure, such as `AppSrc/cMyClass.pkg`. Searching for [NOT is:fork path:Appsrc/**.pkg](https://github.com/search?type=code&q=NOT+is%3Afork+path%3AAppsrc%2F**.pkg
) narrows it down to effectively DataFlex source code files and provides 900+ results. Many of the other file extensions are nowhere near that many, so it won't meet the minimum usage requirements.

Given that there are so many file extensions in use, maybe a better initial approach could be to add support for DataFlex without specifying `extensions` or `filenames` to avoid conflicts. And DataFlex source repositories can use `.gitattributes` overrides for the relevant extensions instead. Obviously not ideal, but it would at least provide recognition for the DataFlex language, and that's a great starting point.

I see there is some precedence for languages without specifying file extensions, such as for Elvish transcripts from PR #6302, which is mainly used inside markdown files. @lildude and @NilsSve, I can help and put up a PR for adding the DataFlex language without specifying any file extensions, would that work?

Hi Sonny,

If you are asking me, yes, that would help! The current repositories at @NilsSve are using .gitattributes exactly as suggested.

> I see there is some precedence for languages without specifying file extensions, such as for Elvish transcripts from PR [#6302](https://github.com/github-linguist/linguist/pull/6302), which is mainly used inside markdown files. [@lildude](https://github.com/lildude) and [@NilsSve](https://github.com/NilsSve), I can help and put up a PR for adding the DataFlex language without specifying any file extensions, would that work?

It would "work" but it won't be accepted. The Elvish exception is because there isn't a common extension as it's predominantly used in a markdown files. This is not the case with DataFlex.

I know nothing about DataFlex but wikipedia says "DataFlex is an object-oriented high-level programming language and a fourth generation visual tool for developing Windows, web and mobile software applications on one framework-based platform."

We do not add support for frameworks, hence we support Ruby, but not Rails, so the right thing to do is concentrate on only the language files. I'd expect the language to have a common extension and structure that can be identified.  This should be what is added first, assuming usage meets requirements, and then users can use the overrides to classify the other extensions if they want.

If the language predominantly uses a generic extension like `.pkg` (poor design decision IMO), this can be added the `generic.yml` file and a heuristic will be used to identify the language, but be warned: this heuristic _must_ be very accurate to only identify DataFlex files and must be linear and performant. It's better for this regex to under identify DataFlex files than misidentify other languages.

> It would "work" but it won't be accepted. The Elvish exception is because there isn't a common extension as it's predominantly used in a markdown files. This is not the case with DataFlex.

I see. That makes sense. DataFlex is an old language that's been around in its current object-oriented form for 20+ years. Its use is mainly for database business applications, for Windows and web apps. It unfortunately doesn't have a single dedicated file extension, and the convention is to use one of a set of extensions representing the main purpose of the specific DataFlex source file. Such as `.vw` for a view, and other extensions for database business logic etc. The `.pkg` extension is typically used for reusable classes, which is why it's the predominant extension seen on GitHub.

> If the language predominantly uses a generic extension like .pkg (poor design decision IMO), this can be added the generic.yml file and a heuristic will be used to identify the language, but be warned: this heuristic must be very accurate to only identify DataFlex files and must be linear and performant. It's better for this regex to under identify DataFlex files than misidentify other languages.

That sounds like a great idea, thanks! I will pursue this strategy for the `.pkg` file extension since it's the most commonly used extension. I'll follow the instructions and add it to `generic.yml` with heuristics and tests. Thanks again!

And may I add that DataFlex has two frameworks. One for Windows and one for the Web, with overlaps between them for datadictionaries for consistent database behaviour.

However, the frameworks are not optionals/add-ons like in many other languages. Instead they are an integrated part of the DataFlex language. And they are written in the DataFlex language.

Sure, a web-based DataFlex application also uses javascript libraries and many other parts needed for a modern webapp, but those files are not part of the frameworks. The build in frameworks are more guided towards how to develop applications more easy, fluently and make the code more robust and easier to follow.

issueDTO.title: [Cache] Allow usage of Caffeine and Redis at the same time
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Currently, the Quarkus cache extension only allows one cache provider (Caffeine or Redis) per application. It would be very useful to support configuring and using both providers at the same time, so different caches can use either in-memory (Caffeine) or distributed (Redis) backends as needed.

This would allow more flexible caching strategies within a single application.

### Implementation ideas

_No response_
comments: /cc @Ladicek (redis), @cescoffier (redis), @gwenneg (cache), @machi1990 (redis)

**Upvote**, I am also interested in this feature. 
I use **redis-cache** for certain caches where it is critical that multiple instances share data.
While for other caches, data sharing between instances is not relevant and speed is really critical and we'd rather use **caffeine-cache**.

repository.description: Quarkus: Supersonic Subatomic Java.
repository.name: quarkus

issueDTO.description:

**Tasks:**

* [ ] Design and implement the `PuzzleAccessLog` entity to store access records (e.g., user ID, puzzle ID, access timestamp).
* [ ] Track the frequency of puzzle access per user or per puzzle.

  * Most accessed puzzles
  * Unique users per puzzle
  * Time-based access trends

issueDTO.title: [SR-873] Python Benchmark Driver needs unit tests
issueDTO.description:
|                  |                 |
   |------------------|-----------------|
   |Previous ID       | SR-873      |
   |Radar             | None         |
   |Original Reporter | @gottesmm      |
   |Type              | Task    |

   <details>
  <summary>Additional Detail from JIRA</summary>

   |                  |                 |
   |------------------|-----------------|
   |Votes             | 0         |
   |Component/s       | Compiler    |
   |Labels            | Task, StarterBug        |
   |Assignee          | None      |
   |Priority          | Medium      |

   

   md5: 9053a294b75b04073c72f457567c4ddd

  </details>





**Issue Description:**


In <https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-871,> we discovered that the upper level python benchmark driver was using lexicographical comparison in order to calculate the minimum/max value/etc.

We should add some basic sanity checking here in terms of a nose test or something like that.
comments: Luke, I am going to unassign this in case any one else wants to try this before you get to it.

I think this can be closed. The test suite already includes tests that exercise min/max logic in the benchmark driver, especially in the test_benchmark_runtime_range and related tests in TestBenchmarkDoctor. 

These tests:

- Create fake benchmark results with various min_value values (including edge cases like 0, 3, 200, 1001, 500000, etc.).
- Assert that the runtime analysis and reporting logic in the driver works as expected.
Use numeric values that would expose lexicographical comparison bugs (e.g., 3 vs 200 vs 1001).

issueDTO.title: [Feature]:  ✨ UX Enhancements Pack: Share Links, Submission Confirmation & Character Counters
issueDTO.description:
# 🎯 Triple-Feature Mission – UX Enhancements Let’s tackle **three small but impactful user experience improvements** in one go! These enhancements aim to improve how citizens interact with the issue reporting and tracking flow. --- ## 1. 📋 Copy Issue Link Button ### Problem There’s currently no easy way to share a direct link to a specific issue. ### Solution - Add a **copy-to-clipboard** button (copy icon) near each issue title. - Clicking it should copy the full permalink of the issue (e.g., `https://civix.app/issues/42`) to the user’s clipboard. - Display a **toast notification** confirming the action. ### Example Usage ```jsx

{issue.title}

 ``` --- ## 2. 🎉 Submission Confirmation ### Problem After reporting an issue, users aren’t clearly informed about success or what to do next. ### Solution - Show a **modal popup** confirming successful submission. - Include the **new issue ID** (e.g., Issue #42). - Offer two clear next steps: - ✅ View the reported issue - ➕ Report another issue ### Mock Layout ``` +-----------------------------+ | 🎉 Thank You! | | ✓ Issue #42 reported! | | | | [ View Issue ] [ Report Another ] | +-----------------------------+ ``` --- ## 3. 🔢 Smart Character Counters ### Problem Users can’t see how many characters they’ve typed or how close they are to a limit. ### Solution - Add **live character counters** to all long-text input fields (e.g., description). - Use color indicators: - 🟢 Normal (< 80%): gray text (`text-gray-500`) - 🟠 Near Limit (≥ 80%): orange text (`text-orange-500`) - 🔴 Over Limit: red text (`text-red-600`) - Set configurable limits (e.g., 500 characters). ### Example UI States | State | Color | Example | |-------------|---------------|----------------| | Normal | Gray | `45 / 500` | | Near Limit | Orange | `410 / 500` | | Over Limit | Red | `502 / 500` | --- ## 🧪 Acceptance Criteria - [ ] All features work correctly in **both Light and Dark modes** - [ ] Fully **mobile-responsive** - [ ] No regressions or broken functionality - [ ] (Optional) Components added to **Storybook** if applicable - [ ] Code includes clear, maintainable structure with reusable components --- ## 🧰 Tech Notes - Copy button may use [`navigator.clipboard.writeText()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Clipboard/writeText) - Toasts can use an existing toast component or [React Hot Toast](https://react-hot-toast.com/) - Character counter can be a custom hook or inline logic for now --- ## 📌 Related Areas - `IssueDetail.jsx` - `NewIssueForm.jsx` - `components/ui/Toast.jsx` - `components/ui/Modal.jsx` - `components/CharacterCounter.jsx` (to be created) --- **Let’s ship these delightfully helpful improvements 🚀**
comments: Hey ! @HarshS16 Please Look at the issue I raised for SSOC 4

Here, we could temporary do a hack where we disable the navigation manually until it is the issue get fix.

issueDTO.title: Create PDF export function
issueDTO.description:
## Description

When the user does a harmonisation, we currently only have an Excel export. Can we make a PDF export using libraries such as `pdfkit` and `airium` so that there is a human readable PDF report of how many items were harmonised, etc?

## Rationale

This is easier to understand for some users than the matrix in the Excel and allows us to include graphics

issueDTO.title: Feature Request: Friend Requests & Friends-Only Chat List
issueDTO.description:
### **📌 Feature Request: Friend Requests & Friends-Only Chat List 🤝**  

#### **Description**  
Implement a **Friend Request System** in **ZeenChat**, allowing users to:  
✅ **Send friend requests** to other users  
✅ **Receive and view pending friend requests**  
✅ **Accept or decline friend requests**  
✅ **Chat only with accepted friends** (hide non-friends from the chat list)  

#### **Why is this needed?**  
🔹 Prevents spam by limiting chats to friends only  
🔹 Makes the chat experience more personal and secure  
🔹 Enhances user engagement and interaction  

---

### **Suggested Approach**  

#### **1️⃣ Backend (Django & Database Updates)**  
- Create a **Friendship model** (`FriendRequest`) to store request statuses (`pending`, `accepted`, `declined`).  
- Update database queries to **only show accepted friends** in the chat list.  

#### **2️⃣ Frontend (JavaScript & UI Updates)**  
- Add a **"Friends" tab** to view pending requests.  
- Show **"Add Friend"** and **"Accept / Decline"** buttons.  
- Display only **accepted friends** in the chat list.  
(The notification icon already exists as commented out part inside the navbar)

---

### **🗂 Relevant Files**  
📂 `chatapp/models.py` – Add FriendRequest model  
📂 `chatapp/views.py` – Implement request handling  
📂 `chatapp/templates/chatapp/chat.html` – Add friend request UI  
📂 `chatapp/static/js/chat.js` – Handle friend-related interactions  

---

### **🚀 Want to Contribute?**  
Comment below if you're interested! We'll guide you through the process. 😊  

#### **Labels:**  
🔹 `enhancement` `good first issue`

issueDTO.title: Feature: By default, require only self-signed certificates in a bundle
issueDTO.description:
Writing down what occurred to me at the end of the cert-manager biweekly meeting on 28/07

An issue with administering trust bundles is that it's very easy + tempting for users to put intermediates in the trust store as a way of "fixing" trust issues. Usually this occurs when an app is buggy and only sends the leaf certificate without its chain, and explicitly trusting the leaf's issuing intermediate CA seems to fix the problem for them. Crucially, when that intermediate is then rotated their app will break.

We could add a toggle, defaulting to false, such as `allowIntermediateCertificates`. If false, it would parse every certificate and ensure that it's self-signed. There might be other ways of achieving the same goal.

Having this in from the start could prevent so many misconfigurations by unsuspecting cluster admins.

(Complication: If we added a list of publicly trusted certs it'd probably need to default to allowing intermediates in that list by default - but we could definitely default to disallowing intermediates everywhere else)
comments: This would disallow cross signing roots. While probably a good default, it shouldn't be added without the toggle.

Somehow related to https://github.com/cert-manager/trust-manager/issues/155, at least the changes would touch overlapping areas of code.

/good-first-issue

/remove-good-first-issue

At least if we like to enable this by default - which could break some users.

<details>

In response to [this](https://github.com/cert-manager/trust-manager/issues/4):

>/good-first-issue


Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md).  If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the [kubernetes-sigs/prow](https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/prow/issues/new?title=Prow%20issue:) repository.
</details>
/remove-lifecycle rotten

Updating with my latest thoughts on this: I probably wouldn't want to enable this by default, but I still think it's a nice option to have. Enabling by default would be too breaking to roll out, and I don't think it's worth it because of the risk of catching cross-signed certs or other valid non-self-signed certs.
While looking at how to implement this, I wonder if we should just ignore any non-self-signed certificate or should we error out. Any thoughts here @SgtCoDFish?

issueDTO.description:
New Kali Linux is out: https://www.kali.org/blog/kali-linux-2025-2-release/

We need to test EMBA on it

**Testcases:**

Testfirmware: [DLink DIR300](https://ftp.dlink.de/dir/dir-300/archive/driver_software/DIR-300_fw_revb_214b01_ALL_de_20130206.zip)

- [x] Default/docker installation working with current docker image
  - [x] `./installer.sh -d` finished without errors
  - [x] dependency check (`./emba -d 1`)
  - [x] EMBA run with profile quick-scan
  - [x] EMBA run with profile default-scan in strict mode (-S)
  - [x] EMBA run with profile default-scan-emulation in strict mode (-S)
  - [x] EMBA run with profile full-scan in strict mode (-S)
- [ ] Docker base image build
  - [ ] `DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1 sudo -E docker compose build --progress=plain --no-cache --pull` finished without errors
  - [ ] dependency check (`./emba -d 2`)
  - [ ] EMBA run with profile quick-scan
  - [ ] EMBA run with profile default-scan in strict mode (-S)
  - [ ] EMBA run with profile default-scan-emulation in strict mode (-S)
  - [ ] EMBA run with profile full-scan in strict mode (-S)
- [ ] Optional full installation working on Kali Linux
  - [ ] `./installer.sh -F` finished without errors
  - [ ] dependency check (`./emba -d 1`)
  - [ ] EMBA run in dev mode with options -s -z -S -D -E -t -W -Q
  - [ ] EMBA run in dev mode with options -s -z -S -D, -c, -E, -t, -W -Q

**Priority issue**
YES
comments:
Hi,

I am doing the first section today.

Installation was OK.

Dependency check shows this:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5ea3725e-9cf9-462d-b084-8a94b85aad02)

1.5.2d was downloaded during the install. All other dependeny are OK. 1st test is running.

Basically all the tests were OK. I got a "No such object" error at the end but the reports are error free.

Quick-scan:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ed08847-bb09-4db0-aa60-d8556b16ab9c)

Default-scan:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ce5dfbe9-5978-4c8a-8bfa-d0d193d0f807)

Default-scan-emulation:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2b0918fc-dfdc-49f8-8381-e9af4d688888)

Full-scan:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/753bbba2-c067-4c0b-9f17-89a66f36cd66)
A quick note on this issue ... The docker build is currently failing.
Should work again ... someone interested in testing the full install and the docker build?

**Update on latest Kali Docker install / re-emulation behavior:**

I tested the **Kali 2025.2 release** using the `run.sh` script and confirmed that while the emulation triggers correctly, it fails due to missing emulation dependencies **outside** the Docker container—namely `uml-utilities` and `qemu-system-mips` aren't present in the host environment, causing the re-emulation step to abort.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3b3126cd-72c7-406d-bf23-f4a9051c4a7b)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab5f278e-c07e-4118-93fe-37681a60bc82)

---

**Proposed next steps:**

* Modify the `run.sh` logic to detect and install required host tools (`uml‑utilities`, `qemu‑system‑mips`)  before starting the re-emulation.
* Alternatively, clarify in the README/docs that these dependencies are required on the host for proper operation outside containerized execution.

Also, as mentioned in the last comment, I’m happy to test the full install and docker build.

> **Update on latest Kali Docker install / re-emulation behavior:**
> 
> I tested the **Kali 2025.2 release** using the `run.sh` script and confirmed that while the emulation triggers correctly, it fails due to missing emulation dependencies **outside** the Docker container—namely `uml-utilities` and `qemu-system-mips` aren't present in the host environment, causing the re-emulation step to abort.

Yes, that is the expectected behaviour. The installer does not install all these dependencies on the host. If you are using system emulation and you would like to use the re-run feature on the host you need to install it manually. On the other hand you could also use the docker base image for the re-run.
Thanks for the explanation, makes sense to me.

issueDTO.title: RBAC: Implement a default role
issueDTO.description:
### Issue submitter TODO list

- [X] I've searched for an already existing issues [here](https://github.com/kafbat/kafka-ui/issues)
- [X] I'm running a supported version of the application which is listed [here](https://github.com/kafbat/kafka-ui/blob/main/.github/SECURITY.md) and the feature is not present there

### Is your proposal related to a problem?

Hi,
When new kafka consumer gives me a request to approach kafka ui (for readonly),
i have to rewrite rbac yaml file.
I deployed two Kafka UI to solve this problem.
First one has basic authentication is for admin users.
The other one is readonly for kafka consumers.

### Describe the feature you're interested in

I think it is useful if the way i can setup default role is exists.
```yaml
rbac:
  roles:
    - name: "admins"
      clusters:
        - development
      subjects:
         - provider: oauth_github
           type: user
           value: 'seono'
      permissions:
        ...
    - name: "readonly"
      clusters:
        - development
      subjects:
        - provider: oauth_github
          type: default
      permissions:
        ...
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I know there is other type `organization` and `team`.
If someone wants readonly permission, I can invite them to the group.
But.. In my case, my company has too many organzations and teams so i can not use it properly.


### Version you're running

https://github.com/kafbat/kafka-ui/commit/9843ee0

### Additional context

_No response_

```patch
diff --git a/eslint.config.js b/eslint.config.js
index 275c4d87..45c5c20c 100644
--- a/eslint.config.js
+++ b/eslint.config.js
@@ -34,6 +34,10 @@ export default [
   {
     rules: {
       // Enable rules
+      "@typescript-eslint/consistent-type-assertions": [
+        "error",
+        { assertionStyle: "never" },
+      ],
       eqeqeq: "error",
     },
   },
```

issueDTO.title: allow fine-grained source/destination selection
issueDTO.description:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
<!--- If you believe the issue may have security implications, please report it as a vulnerability -->
<!--- Report a vulnerability: https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/security -->

We are currently re-working our network policies by introducing GlobalNetworkSets. We have labeled each network set with something like `networking.our.internal.stuff/networkset: <name>` to be able to select a single network set in our network policies. We are concerned that someone accidentally adds the same label to a pod or another resource and thus undermines our network policies.

## Expected Behavior
<!--- If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen -->
<!--- If you're suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work -->

It would be cool if something similar to `projectcalico.org/orchestrator` exists that lets us specify the resource type we want to select. 

## Current Behavior
<!--- If describing a bug, tell us what happens instead of the expected behavior -->
<!--- If suggesting a change/improvement, explain the difference from current behavior -->

We can use `global()` to select across all global resources, but cannot limit this to just GlobalNetworkSets. We can use an external policy agent, like OPA or kyverno, to disallow setting our networkset labels on resources that are not network sets but this requires an additional system to be deployed.

## Possible Solution
<!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix/reason for the bug, -->
<!--- or ideas how to implement the addition or change -->

Calico could automatically add a new label, e.g. `projectcalico.org/kind` to each calico resource so that we can select resources by kind and their labels within the same selector. In our case, we could write a selector like `networking.our.internal.stuff/networkset == "some-name" && projectcalico.org/kind == "GlobalNetworkSet"`

Another solution would be something like a `kind(GlobalNetworkSet)` expression that does the same, but does not require an extra label.

## Context
<!--- How has this issue affected you? What are you trying to accomplish? -->
<!--- Providing context helps us come up with a solution that is most useful in the real world -->

We want to be as strict as possible in our network policies and close any potential loophole that might exist in our setup.
comments:
I think this would be a good feature to have (given that we didn't split selector by type in the first place).

Note that k8s now has built in support for label validation/RBAC via the [validating admission policy](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/validating-admission-policy/) resource.

Another issue with the current approach: GlobalNetworkSets are global by nature and thus their names are unique. Their labels are not. It is possible to add the same label to two different network sets potentially allowing much more than expected. Something like `kind(GlobalNetworkSet) && name(Something)` as an expression would perfectly express what we want without allowing any potential misconfiguration.

Again, we can work around this using additional tooling (VAP/OPA/Kyverno) that verifies that the value of our `networking.our.internal.stuff/networkset` label exactly matches the name of a global network set, but built-in support for more precision when declaring network policies would be really nice!

Hey guys,

I'd love to try and work on this one. Do you have a general advice where I should start with this?

Thanks @ivnhk ! 

I'd start by familiarizing yourself with how to build and run Calico and its tests. There's a general contribution guide here: https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md (although I'll admit, it might be a tad out of date...)

You might also want to poke around to see how the (very similar) `orchestrator` label is handled for kubernetes pods. Here's a hint: https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/blob/f3da524b7c6e4cfdf9874b2cddd0233213a1d8f3/libcalico-go/lib/backend/k8s/conversion/workload_endpoint_default.go#L163

We convert pods into an internal type called "WorkloadEndpoint" and when we do, we force a label to be set on it for selection. 

For NetworkSets, you could probably do something similar - or even better since it's an API that we control, you could also add it to the defaulting and validation code for that API - here are some hints on that part:

- https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/blob/master/libcalico-go/lib/clientv3/networkset.go
- https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/blob/f3da524b7c6e4cfdf9874b2cddd0233213a1d8f3/libcalico-go/lib/validator/v3/validator.go#L269-L270

issueDTO.title: Detect the draw rules of chess
issueDTO.description:
Currently, the app does not check for draw rules such as insufficient material, threefold repetition, and the 50-move rule without captures.

- **Insufficient Material**: Neither player has enough pieces to force a checkmate (e.g., king versus king, king and bishop versus king, or king and knight versus king).
- **Threefold Repetition**: The same position occurs three times with the same player to move and all possible moves available.
- **50-Move Rule**: Fifty moves have been made by each player without any pawn movement or capture.

These rules need to be incorporated into the logic and adjusted according to the existing notification and labeling system. This implementation should be done as elegantly as the checkmate detection.

issueDTO.description:
https://github.com/inspektor-gadget/inspektor-gadget/issues/3168 added support for `daemon-config` but currently we don't support any client-side validation. In helm-charts we are using https://github.com/inspektor-gadget/inspektor-gadget/blob/main/charts/gadget/values.schema.json to perform early validations, similar approach can be used with `daemon-config`.

## Ideal Situation:

```yaml
# daemon-config.yaml
hookMode: foo
```

```
$ kubectl gadget deploy --daemon-config=daemon-config.yaml
Error: invalid argument "foo" for --hook-mode=[auto,crio,podinformer,nri,fanotify+ebpf]
```

issueDTO.title: Don't create tool manifests in a .config subfolder by default
issueDTO.description:
A tool manifest file (dotnet-tools.json) can either be directly in the folder it applies to, or it can be in a `.config` subfolder.  The idea behind this was to group multiple configuration files in the `.config` folder in order to avoid cluttering the repo root.

However, we never ended up adding any other files to the .config subfolder.  So now we'd like to simplify local tools by putting the manifest file directly into the folder it applies to.

This will involve updating the tool-manifest template, as well as the code in the .NET CLI that creates the manifest if necessary.

Documentation, such as [this page](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/local-tools-how-to-use), should also be updated.

issueDTO.title: Remove instance of green alert with lock icon
issueDTO.description:
### Duplicate check

### This update is for:

Component

### What is the name?

Green alert with lock icon (old sign in styling)

### What is the nature of this update?

- [ ] How to build this component/pattern
- [ ] When to use this component/pattern
- [ ] When to use something else
- [ ] Usability guidance
- [ ] Accessibility considerations
- [ ] Content considerations

issueDTO.title: bug: frontend wrongly handle ingest error
issueDTO.description:
# Bug

Try to access : `127.0.0.1:8000/something`, the API return a empty error and a 400 (bad request) error.
The frontend doesn't properly handle the error, resulting in a empty git ingest result :

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eac08385-caaa-41f3-bc2c-6e862098f2ef)

# Fix

1. handle 400 error code in utils.js
2. make error more descriptive

issueDTO.title: Rework docstrings to have consistent style
issueDTO.description:
It would be great to be consistent with the style of the existing docstrings, i.e. start the sentence with a verb for "brief". For example, I would put it here

```cpp
/**
 * @brief Publish the state of the controller manager.
 * 
 * The state includes the list of controllers and the list of hardware interfaces along with their states.
 */
```

However, I realize that we have already different docstring styles in this file. An example of another style is:

```cpp
/// A method to register a callback to be called when the list is switched
/**
* \param[in] callback Callback to be called when the list is switched
*/
```

Is it intentional to have these different styles? @christophfroehlich

_Originally posted by @Maverobot in https://github.com/ros-controls/ros2_control/pull/2006#discussion_r1921631365_
comments:
Hello @christophfroehlich,

I have worked on this issue and submitted a PR: [#2087][(https://github.com/Vishwanathkarne/pull/2087) ](https://github.com/ros-controls/ros2_control/pull/2087#issue-2889722330).

- I have ensured a consistent docstring style across the codebase.
- Followed the suggested format with @brief starting with a verb.
- Standardized different styles to improve clarity and maintainability.

This is my 1st open-source contribution, and I would love your feedback! 
Let me know if any improvements are needed. 
Thanks for this opportunity!
@christophfroehlich @saikishor 

Regards,
Vishwanath Karne
@christophfroehlich Is he still assigned to this issue? On the Contributing page, it’s empty.
there was no response in the PR from @im23123v since March?

issueDTO.title: Add some documentation on how `cover_url` is meant to be used
issueDTO.description: it would be great if there would be some documentation about `MediaMetadata::cover_url`, like what format it should be in, or if there is anything platform specific (and if needed what formats are supported, like recommending jpg?)
comments:
It is very platform specific. As of now, Souvlaki leaves it up to the user to change the URL depending on the platform.

For Linux, we follow the MPRIS specification, which actually doesn't say much cover art apart from what's in [here](https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/mpris-spec/metadata/#mpris:arturl). It only says that local files should start with `file://` and that it should be an UTF-8 string, which is enforced by Rust. Maybe you can look in the source code of desktop managers such as GNOME or KDE, since these read the field to display it on their media player controls.

For Windows, we use the _SystemMediaTransportControlsDisplayUpdater_, which has [a thumbnail property](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.media.systemmediatransportcontrolsdisplayupdater.thumbnail?view=winrt-22621#windows-media-systemmediatransportcontrolsdisplayupdater-thumbnail). It accepts multiple formats, but we choose to create it using an URI. If setting an URL starting with `file://`, the file is automatically loaded by souvlaki.

For MacOS, you can look into [these lines](https://github.com/Sinono3/souvlaki/blob/384539fe83e8bf5c966192ba28e9405e3253619b/src/platform/macos/mod.rs#L131-L137) of the implementation. These lines refer to creating an [MPMediaItemArtwork](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/mediaplayer/mpmediaitemartwork) object.

I hope this is of use to you. If you find a good way to put this information in the docs, consider opening a pull request 🙂
Documented in 5b89e4bae455e5aed07e2f57f9d8a5b92e62ecf5

As a FYI and because not much is documented in the respective platforms and at least verified on Linux-MPRIS-dbus-KDE, the format of `data:MIMETYPE;base64,BASE64DATA` seems to work without problems.
And i have not yet seen complaints of it not working in windows, mac or other linux environments.
By the way, [mpv-mpris](https://archlinux.org/packages/extra/x86_64/mpv-mpris/) seems to also use this format on linux.

[termusic souvlaki cover_art setting](https://github.com/tramhao/termusic/blob/4fa58b87f15f5d87f705de2b38998563d28ba480/playback/src/mpris.rs#L73-L91).
[MDN data: URLs - URIs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/URI/Reference/Schemes/data)

> As a FYI and because not much is documented in the respective platforms and at least verified on Linux-MPRIS-dbus-KDE, the format of `data:MIMETYPE;base64,BASE64DATA` seems to work without problems. And i have not yet seen complaints of it not working in windows, mac or other linux environments. By the way, mpv seems to also use this format on linux.
> 
> [termusic souvlaki cover_art setting](https://github.com/tramhao/termusic/blob/4fa58b87f15f5d87f705de2b38998563d28ba480/playback/src/mpris.rs#L73-L91). [MDN data: URLs - URIs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/URI/Reference/Schemes/data)

Perhaps this is the solution to https://github.com/Sinono3/souvlaki/issues/62 for Linux? That's pretty neat, I've noticed even Google Chrome writes to a temporary file and uses a a `file://` url when using MPRIS.

Wow @hasezoey, that's actually great news. I'll add that to the docs as well, but before I'll test on macOS and Windows.

- [x] Tested on macOS
- [x] Tested on Windows

Working well on Windows!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/807892b0-b10d-4f12-8d2d-b3933dc80f9f)

One thing to note - seems like you **must** call `set_cover` before `set_metadata`. I made the mistake of calling them in the wrong order and the cover art would only be updated on the next time the track changed

> Working well on Windows!

Just to confirm, are you referring to the data urls (`data:`) i mentioned earlier?

> Just to confirm, are you referring to the data urls (`data:`) i mentioned earlier?

there's a native Windows API for loading images as bytes (which is what works) but it does fall back to data URLs on MPRIS

issueDTO.title: Improve test coverage of PID class
issueDTO.description:
## Background
The PID class is a base implementation for lots of controllers. Therefore, we should thrive for full test coverage

Having a look at the [coverage report](https://app.codecov.io/gh/ros-controls/control_toolbox/tree/ros2-master/control_toolbox), we see that some methods have no coverage, e.g., 

- `void PidROS::reset()`
- `void PidROS::reset(bool save_i_term)`
- `double PidROS::compute_command(double error, double error_dot, const rclcpp::Duration & dt)`
- `void PidROS::set_current_cmd(double cmd) { pid_.set_current_cmd(cmd); }`
- `double PidROS::get_current_cmd() { return pid_.get_current_cmd(); }`
- `void PidROS::print_values()`

and in general, we have little coverage in testing the input validations.

Improve that by additional tests/test-cases.

## Instructions
Hi, this is a `good-first-issue` issue. This means we've worked to make it more legible to people who either **haven't contributed to our codebase before, or even folks who haven't contributed to open source before**.

We're interested in helping you take the first step, and can answer questions and help you out along the way. Note that we're especially interested in contributions from underrepresented groups!

We know that creating a pull request is the biggest barrier for new contributors. This issue is for you 💝

If you have contributed before, **consider leaving this PR for someone new**, and looking through our general [bug](https://github.com/ros-controls/ros2_control/labels/bug) issues. Thanks!

### 🤔 What you will need to know.

Nothing. This issue is meant to welcome you to Open Source :) We are happy to walk you through the process.

### 📋 Step by Step

- [ ] 🙋 **Claim this issue**: Comment below. If someone else has claimed it, ask if they've opened a pull request already and if they're stuck -- maybe you can help them solve a problem or move it along!

- [ ] 🗄️ **Create a local workspace** for making your changes and testing [following these instructions](https://docs.ros.org/en/rolling/Tutorials/Workspace/Creating-A-Workspace.html), for Step 3 use "Download Source Code" section with [these instructions](https://control.ros.org/master/doc/getting_started/getting_started.html#building-from-source).

- [ ] 🍴 **Fork the repository** using the handy button at the top of the repository page and **clone** it into `~/ws_ros2_control/src/ros-controls/ros2_control`, [here is a guide that you can follow](https://guides.github.com/activities/forking/) (You will have to remove or empty the existing `ros2_control` folder before cloning your own fork)

- [ ] **Checkout a new branch** using `git checkout -b <branch_name>`

- [ ] 🤖 **Apply `pre-commit`** auto formatting, by running `pip3 install pre-commit` and running `pre-commit install` in the ros2_control repo.

- [ ] 💾 **Commit and Push** your changes

- [ ] 🔀 **Start a Pull Request** to request to merge your code into `master`. There are two ways that you can start a pull request:
1. If you are not familiar with GitHub or how to create a pull request, [here is a guide you can follow](https://guides.github.com/activities/hello-world/) on how GitHub works.

- [ ] 🏁 **Done** Ask in comments for a review :)

### Is someone else already working on this?

🔗- We encourage contributors to link to the original issue in their pull request so all users can easily see if someone's already started on it.

👥- **If someone seems stuck, offer them some help!**

### 🤔❓ Questions?

Don’t hesitate to ask questions or to get help if you feel like you are getting stuck. For example leave a comment below!
Furthermore, you find helpful resources here:
* [ROS2 Control Contribution Guide](https://control.ros.org/master/doc/contributing/contributing.html)
* [ROS2 Tutorials](https://docs.ros.org/en/rolling/Tutorials.html)
* [Robotics Stack Exchange](https://robotics.stackexchange.com)

**Good luck with your first issue!**
comments: Is there a threshold time for this issue to be taken by non-beginners?

issueDTO.title: [docs] Add node_selection_strategy to the Presto documentation
issueDTO.description:
Add documentation for `node_selection_strategy` to the Presto documentation. 

## Expected Behavior or Use Case
Documentation should be present. 

## Presto Component, Service, or Connector
Documentation. 


## Context
When reviewing #24193 I noticed that `node_selection_strategy` is mentioned in the doc for `query-data-cache-enabled-default` in [Presto C++ Features](https://github.com/prestodb/presto/blob/master/presto-docs/src/main/sphinx/presto_cpp/features.rst), but wasn't documented itself. 

Note: after this was opened, `node_selection_strategy` and `query-data-cache-enabled-default` were removed from `query-data-cache-enabled-default` in [Presto C++ Features](https://github.com/prestodb/presto/blob/master/presto-docs/src/main/sphinx/presto_cpp/features.rst). 

`node_selection_strategy` is mentioned in [Session Properties](https://prestodb.io/docs/current/connector/iceberg.html#session-properties) of the Iceberg Connector and in [Hive Changes](https://prestodb.io/docs/current/release/release-0.233.html#hive-changes) in the 0.233 Release Notes. 

_Add configuration property hive.node-selection-strategy to choose NodeSelectionStrategy. When SOFT_AFFINITY is selected, scheduler will make the best effort to request the same worker to fetch the same file._

`hive.node-selection-strategy` is mentioned in [Iceberg Connector](https://prestodb.io/docs/current/connector/iceberg.html), but is not mentioned in [Hive Connector.](https://prestodb.io/docs/current/connector/hive.html)

issueDTO.title: Automate manual post-installation steps for Docker setup
issueDTO.description:
## Issue Description

Currently, the Docker installation process requires several manual steps to be executed after running `docker-compose up --build -d`. These manual steps create friction for new users and go against Docker's principle of providing a complete, automated setup experience.

## Current Manual Steps

After running `docker-compose up --build -d`, users must manually execute:

```bash
docker exec -it samarium_app npm run dev
docker exec -it samarium_app composer dump-autoload
docker exec -it samarium_app php artisan migrate
docker exec -it samarium_app php artisan key:generate
docker exec -it samarium_app php artisan storage:link
docker exec -it samarium_app php artisan db:seed
```

## Expected Behavior

The Docker setup should be fully automated - users should only need to run:
1. `cp .env.docker.example .env`
2. `docker-compose up --build -d`

After these commands, the application should be ready to use without any additional manual intervention.

repository.description: Open-source business management system with ERP, POS, invoicing, and CMS features. Laravel-based, Docker-ready. Still in active development.
repository.name: samarium

summary.main: Automate manual post-installation steps for Docker setup. The current manual steps require users to execute several commands after running `docker-compose up --build -d`, which creates friction for new users and goes against Docker's principle of providing a complete, automated setup experience.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The Docker setup should be fully automated, and users should only need to run two commands: `cp .env.docker.example .env` and `docker-compose up --build -d`.
