issueDTO.title: Update in progress button state for consistency
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

When a button has a related "in progress" state such as a navigation or background request, we don't always handle this consistently. This is similar to #10281 but specific to the appearance.

For example, when saving settings [we include an ellipsis](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/8f1c16bb71bcf5091bc5b56d535e03973d4b9b36/assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/Footer.js#L153-L155), but in nearly all other similar buttons we do not.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* When module settings are being saved, after CTA has been clicked and CTA enters in progress state, only spinner icon should be showing, text shouldn't be changing to the `Saving` and ellipsis should not show `...`

## Implementation Brief

* [ ] Update `assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/FooterPrimaryAction.js`
  * Remove https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/4946f1a5df79dfac2ac8f94c6a03283a163241a1/assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/FooterPrimaryAction.js#L75 and conditional wrapper around it.
  * Spinner is already integrated, so no further change is needed

### Test Coverage

* No updates expected

## QA Brief

* <!-- One or more bullet points for how to test that the feature works as expected. -->

## Changelog entry

* <!-- One sentence summarizing the PR, to be used in the changelog. -->
comments: I have reached out to @sigal-teller and @marrrmarrr in Slack about how best to handle this, [see Slack conversation here](https://fueled10up.slack.com/archives/C01CA828ZPZ/p1741178336319719).
Based on the thread in the slack referenced in previous comment - buttons should keep the spinner only, and legacy elipsis/text change should be removed
@zutigrm this shouldn't be only specific for module settings. We need to do it for all progress button across our codebase to make sure we have consistent approach everywhere.

Thanks @eugene-manuilov, I know AC is more module settings centric, but it's because we do not have this occurrence anywhere else in our codebase, this is the only place we need to remove/update it. All other buttons use spinner without ellipsis
Ah, thanks for clarifying it, @zutigrm. AC ✔
IB ✅

issueDTO.title: Docs: Change Cosmos in Astro docs to support Airflow 3 deployments
issueDTO.description:
In Astro cloud Airflow 3 deployments, the `dags` folder is managed by the versioned bundle backend, which means that `$AIRFLOW_HOME` no longer references the actual path of any auxiliary files in the `dags` folder. 

Change references from ```/usr/local/airflow/dags/my_dbt_project``` to something that will actually work.

This means this example is no longer valid for Airflow 3 in Astro:
https://astronomer.github.io/astronomer-cosmos/getting_started/astro.html

We need to change it to something like:
```
from pathlib import Path
from cosmos import DbtDag, ProjectConfig

my_cosmos_dag = DbtDag(
    project_config=ProjectConfig(
        dbt_project_path=(Path(__file__).parent / "my_dbt_project").absolute().to_posix(),
    ),
    # ...,
)
```

For it to work.

More context:
https://astronomer.slack.com/archives/C07AN54AJHX/p1750752703113999

We should verify if any other examples or DAGs need to be modified to work with both Airflow 2 and Airflow 3 in Astro.

repository.name: astronomer-cosmos

summary.main: Change Cosmos in Astro docs to support Airflow 3 deployments, specifically updating references to the `dags` folder to make them work with Airflow 3 in Astro.
summary.validationOrRequirement: In Astro cloud Airflow 3 deployments, the `dags` folder is managed by the versioned bundle backend, which means that `$AIRFLOW_HOME` no longer references the actual path of any auxiliary files in the `dags` folder.
summary.attemptedFixes: Change references from `/usr/local/airflow/dags/my_dbt_project` to something that will actually work, like `from pathlib import Path; from cosmos import DbtDag, ProjectConfig; my_cosmos_dag = DbtDag(project_config=ProjectConfig(dbt_project_path=(Path(__file__).parent / "my_dbt_project").absolute().to_posix(),), ...),`
summary.otherNotes: More context can be found at https://astronomer.slack.com/archives/C07AN54AJHX/p1750752703113999

comments: /labels receiver/azuremonitor -needs-triage good-first-issue

Pinging code owners for receiver/azuremonitor: @nslaughter @celian-garcia @ishleenk17. See [Adding Labels via Comments](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-labels-via-comments) if you do not have permissions to add labels yourself. For example, comment '/label priority:p2 -needs-triaged' to set the priority and remove the needs-triaged label.

Hi @celian-garcia Would it be okay if I take on this issue?
Also, I’d really appreciate it if you could provide a more detailed explanation of the problem and the expected solution?

😲 I feel bad. Checking the implementation to give you details, I actually found out that something was already existing but not documented. 

Following config
```yaml
append_tags_as_attributes: true
```
Is getting all the tags of the scraped resource and append them with label tags_{tag}={tag_value}

Despite this would work, I would like to have a bit more control. Some tags could have a uncontrolled cardinality. 

So what I propose would be to turn that field into a list (breaking change are okish since it's alpha)
Similar to what has been done there https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/receiver/azuremonitorreceiver/README.md#filtering-metrics
```yaml
append_tags_as_attributes: [*] # takes every tag
append_tags_as_attributes: ["service", "something"] # takes only tags service and something
```

issueDTO.title: Update macro template to support Swift Testing tests
issueDTO.description:
According to the SwiftPM code base, we are unable to use [Swift Testing to verify macros](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-package-manager/blob/main/Sources/Workspace/InitPackage.swift#L119-L122). However, the referenced GitHub issue (https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-syntax/issues/2400) is closed.

The [Swift Syntax 600 release notes](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-syntax/blob/main/Release%20Notes/600.md) mentions `SwiftSyntaxMacrosGenericTestSupport`.  

Here is a snippet of the relevant Swift Syntax release notes

> `SwiftSyntaxMacrosGenericTestSupport`
> - Description: A version of the `SwiftSyntaxMacrosTestSupport` module that doesn't depend on `Foundation` or `XCTest` and can thus be used to write macro tests using `swift-testing`. Since swift-syntax can't depend on swift-testing (which would incur a circular dependency since swift-testing depends on swift-syntax), users need to manually specify a failure handler like the following, that fails the swift-testing test: `Issue.record("\($0.message)", fileID: $0.location.fileID, filePath: $0.location.filePath, line: $0.location.line, column: $0.location.column)`
> - Pull request: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-syntax/pull/2647


The SwiftPM template for `swift package init --type macro` should be update to provide an idiomatic way to write a Swift Testing test to verify and validate a macro.

repository.description: The Package Manager for the Swift Programming Language
repository.name: swift-package-manager

summary.main: Update macro template to support Swift Testing tests
summary.validationOrRequirement: According to the SwiftPM code base, we are unable to use Swift Testing to verify macros.
summary.otherNotes: The referenced GitHub issue (https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-syntax/issues/2400) is closed. The Swift Syntax 600 release notes mention SwiftSyntaxMacrosGenericTestSupport.

issueDTO.title: Simplify test code where a dataset is set as gated
issueDTO.description:
[huggingface_hub@0.25.0](https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface_hub/releases/tag/v0.25.0) provides an API to set a repository as gated.

We had included a custom version of `update_repo_settings` because it lacked a `gated` parameter. Now we can switch back to the `huggingface_hub` method

https://github.com/huggingface/dataset-viewer/blob/4859100ef282dcf73257dfb60e6b5a20d5955c68/jobs/cache_maintenance/tests/utils.py#L41
https://github.com/huggingface/dataset-viewer/blob/4859100ef282dcf73257dfb60e6b5a20d5955c68/services/admin/tests/fixtures/hub.py#L24
https://github.com/huggingface/dataset-viewer/blob/4859100ef282dcf73257dfb60e6b5a20d5955c68/services/worker/tests/fixtures/hub.py#L35
comments: depends on https://github.com/huggingface/dataset-viewer/issues/3064

Hi @severo — I’d like to pick this up.

Now that `huggingface_hub>=0.25.0` supports the `gated` parameter in `HfApi.update_repo_settings`, I’ll remove the custom implementations in the following test files:

- `jobs/cache_maintenance/tests/utils.py`
- `services/admin/tests/fixtures/hub.py`
- `services/worker/tests/fixtures/hub.py`

Each call to `update_repo_settings(...)` will be replaced with the official method, and the custom functions will be removed. Let me know if that sounds good!

issueDTO.title: Time Series Support
issueDTO.description:
This issue is designed to track progress towards full time series support in TorchGeo. If you are interested in helping with this effort, please join the `#time-series` channel on [Slack](https://join.slack.com/t/torchgeo/shared_invite/zt-22rse667m-eqtCeNW0yI000Tl4B~2PIw) and attend our weekly meetings.

### Datasets

#### Required changes

- [x] Replace R-tree with geopandas: #2747
- [x] Spatial-only intersection: #2837
- [ ] Return time series: #2308 
- [ ] Xarray support: #1490
- [ ] ERA5
- [ ] CMIP6
- [ ] WeatherBench
- [ ] Convert change detection datasets: #2862, #2863
- [ ] Convert time series datasets
- [ ] Splitters: guarantee non-overlapping spatial and/or temporal splits
- [ ] Collation functions for padding

#### Desired changes

- [x] Replace BoundingBox with slicing: #2804
- [x] Support Polygon ROIs in all splitters: #2835
- [ ] Deprecate BoundingBox: #2847
- [ ] Properly handle vector datasets, drop fiona dependency: @isaaccorley
- [ ] Store true image footprint: #1881
- [ ] Cache geopandas index: @isaaccorley
- [ ] Support integer indexing?: @adamjstewart
- [ ] Unify GeoDataset and NonGeoDataset?: #1353
- [ ] Intersection/Union multiple queries?: #2408
- [ ] Tuple/MultiQuery dataset?: #877

### Samplers

- [x] Support Polygon ROIs in all samplers: #2812
- [ ] Reimplement spatial samplers
- [ ] Add new temporal samplers: #877
- [ ] Ensure samplers do not sample outside Polygon bounds
- [ ] Support weighted samplers: #757

### Transforms

- [x] B x T x C x H x W <-> B x TC x H x W: #2477
- [ ] Temporal embeddings: #2826
- [ ] Temporal up/downsampling: @yichiac 
- [ ] UTC time <-> local time: @yichiac 
- [ ] Data imputation: @yichiac 

### Models

#### Pixel-wise

- [x] RNNs: LSTMs, GRUs
- [ ] Seq2Seq: #2639 
- [ ] L-TAE: #2867
- [ ] TempCNN: https://github.com/charlotte-pel/temporalCNN
- [ ] Chronos: @cnagda?
- [ ] Presto: @cnagda?

#### Spatiotemporal

- [x] SatlasPretrain
- [ ] Conv-LSTM
- [ ] CNN-LSTM
- [ ] Prithvi: @isaaccorley 
- [ ] SatMAE: @isaaccorley 
- [ ] SkySense
- [ ] Aurora: #2823
- [ ] NeuralGCM: #2850
- [ ] Climate: @cnagda?

### Trainers

- [x] Change detection: #2422
- [ ] Autoregression: #2639
- [ ] Modify existing trainers: @keves1

### Documentation

- [ ] Crop type mapping tutorial: #2449 
- [ ] Change detection tutorial
- [ ] Air pollution tutorial
- [ ] Weather forecasting tutorial: @cnagda
- [ ] Climate modeling tutorial?: @cnagda

### Outdated discussions

- #640
- #1544

summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue description lists several required and desired changes, including replacing BoundingBox with slicing, support for integer indexing, and proper handling of vector datasets.
summary.attemptedFixes: Various fixes are mentioned in the issue description, including replacing R-tree with geopandas, spatial-only intersection, and support for Polygon ROIs in all splitters and samplers.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is designed to track progress towards full time series support in TorchGeo. If you are interested in helping with this effort, please join the `#time-series` channel on Slack and attend our weekly meetings.

issueDTO.title: Increase test coverage on backend
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

- We have some good backend tests for endpoints.
- They are invaluable for checking changes to the backend.
- It allows for fast changes as we have more assurances our code didn't break anything downstream.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

- More test cases for the backend APIs.
- Functionality is reasonably stable now, so we should add tests for most.
- Coverage of about 80% with good edge case coverage would be great going forward.
- This is key to avoid breaking changes when we add new features or modify existing code.
- The response for each endpoint should be inspected and checked for the essential fields it should have, plus to check if they are valid values.

repository.description: Field Tasking Manager - coordinated field mapping.
repository.name: field-tm

summary.main: The main issue is that the backend tests are not comprehensive enough, making it difficult to ensure that changes to the code do not break existing functionality.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to increase the test coverage on the backend to ensure that changes to the code do not break existing functionality.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to a problem where the backend tests are not comprehensive enough, making it difficult to ensure that changes to the code do not break existing functionality. The solution proposed is to add more test cases for the backend APIs, aiming for a coverage of about 80% with good edge case coverage.

issueDTO.title: Replace sync osm_fieldwork.OdkCentral code with PyODK functionality
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

- osm-fieldwork was developed before pyodk.
- PyODK - as the official Python ODK - has much of the functionality we need.
- We still require much from OdkCentralAsync though, as we have some methods that don't exist in PyODK, plus PyODK has no async capability.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

- Many of our helper functions to get OdkProject, OdkForm, etc, can be replaced with
```python
from pyodk._utils.config import CentralConfig
from pyodk.client import Client

async def get_odk_client(odk_central: central_schemas.ODKCentralDecrypted):
    """Helper function to get the OdkForm with credentials."""
    pyodk_config = CentralConfig(
        base_url=odk_central.odk_central_url,
        username=odk_central.odk_central_user,
        password=odk_central.odk_central_password,
    )
    with Client(pyodk_config) as client:
        yield client
```

- Check if we need to wrap the functionality in error handling, or if this is handled by PyODK (I believe it's probably handled by PyODK automatically.
- Replace all project / form / appuser updates with this functionality.
- Keep entity list (dataset), entity, and bulk submission downloads as async via osm_fieldwork.OdkCentralAsync (perhaps rename this though)

**Additional context**

- After doing this we can significantly simplify the osm-fieldwork classes - to the bare minimum additional functionality.
- We don't need an unasync approach, as sync code should be contributed to pyodk, and async code kept in osm-fieldwork.

issueDTO.title: Prices from product page seem limited to 10 items
issueDTO.description:
### What
- In the product page there's a "Prices" tab.
- In this tab we see the number of prices for that product, and with a click we go to a page listing those prices.
- The thing is that we only see the top 10 items, without any possibility to scroll down to see more.
- For the record, when we go on a "My prices" page and click on a product price count, we go to a page that lists all the items after scrolling down, not only the top 10.

### Steps to reproduce the behavior
1. Go to a product page
2. Go to the "prices" tab
3. You'll see a badge counting the number of prices
4. If it's more than 10, click on the button.
5. You'll land on a page with only 10 prices, with no way to get more.

### Expected behavior
We should have the same behavior in both "product price" pages.

### Screenshot/Mockup/Before-After
Issue - 30 prices but only top 10 are visible
| 30 prices | but 10 prices | and 10 prices |
| -- | -- | -- |
| ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/693bedca-74c1-42ab-95c0-6be7c199ea6f) | ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/32b5e93b-03ad-404c-98ba-4784dce54dc8) | ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4f8d0584-5687-4ef3-89ca-94c3fd19b846) |

Correct - 30 prices and all of them are visible after scrolling down

issueDTO.title: Total contributions on infographics doesn't match with number of submissions by respective users
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Many users have been in confusion that the contribution means number of submissions made by them however its not the case in here. The contribution consists of number of activity performed on each tasks, meaning the lock and unlock of tasks or update of tasks status. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to 'project details page'
2. Click on 'view submissions'
3. Scroll down to 'total contribution table'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
Modify the total contributors table to show number of submissions per user including new features submissions. 

**Alternative solution**
Add an info icon to clarify users that the table consists of number of activity performed on each tasks that is stored on task history table and maynot match with number of submissions user has sent.

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2f788ab1-b16c-4f3b-82c0-b80830c488fd)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f22d2418-fbfc-46a7-a879-a02132e96714)

**Additional context**
This confusion was raised by KU field mapathon.
comments:
We should probably count them separately per user:
- Overall contributions
- Mapped features (from the overall contributions)

issueDTO.title: Plots that need to be updated to use the new ComputeGraph
issueDTO.description:
This is a quick overview of which recipes still need to be translated to use the ComputeGraph (Makie 0.24)

Some recipes more or less just require replacing `map/lift/@lift/on/onany` with `map!`. The 0.24 blog post has/will have some instructions on how to do this, so it should be easy for anyone to do. If you want to contribute something relatively small feel free to update one (or more) and make a pull request. A rough list of easy plots/recipes:
- [ ] arc
- [ ] band
- [ ] pie
- [ ] poly
- [ ] stairs
- [ ] stem
- [ ] tooltip
- [ ] wireframe
- [ ] density
- [ ] qqplot (distributions.jl)
- [ ] stephist
- [ ] hist
- [ ] timeseries
- [ ] series

Some recipes still use `register_computation!()` when they could use `map!()`. This should be a fairly easy cleanup/replacement as well.
- [ ] tricontourf
- [ ] spy
- [ ] scatterlines

Some recipes may require some more refactoring, like breaking up an `onany` that updates multiple observables. They should still be fairly easy to translate (though I haven't checked in depth). `contourf` or `errorbars` might be an instructive example.
- [ ] arrows
- [ ] barplot
- [ ] contour
- [ ] triplot
- [ ] waterfall
- [ ] boxplot
- [ ] crossbar
- [ ] hexbin
- [ ] violin

Some recipes apply transformations and projections. These should probably be delayed a bit, as we can/should extend what's happening for primitive plots to recipe plots here
- ~~hlines, vlines, hspan, vspan (+ limit tracking)~~
- [ ] annotation (+ bbox handling)
- [ ] bracket
- [ ] streamplot (or maybe refactor rotation handling?)
- [ ] textlabel
- [ ] voronoiplot

Other:
- [ ] volumeslices (how do we want to handle the transformation system)

Not sure if done:
- [ ] axis3d (maybe needs full rework?)
- [ ] datashader
- [ ] rainclouds

issueDTO.title: [Documentation Improvement] Typo in cache retention documentation
issueDTO.description:
### Issue type

Wrong or misleading information

### Problem description

There appears to be a typo in the documentation on how to set cache retention:

Add a file like this in ~/.gradle/**init.d**:

beforeSettings {
    caches {
        buildCache.setRemoveUnusedEntriesAfterDays(30)
    }
}

I believe the file referenced instead should be ~/.gradle/init.**gradle**

### Context (optional)

_No response_

### Page with the problem

https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/upgrading_version_8.html#directory_build_cache_retention_deprecated
comments:
This is a valid documentation issue.

****

The dir is correct, but the path is missing a filename: `~/.gradle/init.d/cache.init.gradle.kts`
Ah I see - thank you!
Hey @ov7a / @aferg could you please review ?

issueDTO.title: Do not ignore schema of a table
issueDTO.description:
When you are adding a new table, you can specify a schema. For example:

```
ALTER DISTRIBUTION ds1 ATTACH RELATION schema_name.table_name DISTRIBUTION KEY id;
```

In fact, during query/transaction routing, the schema is not taken into account. If there are tables with the same name but different schemas, they will be incorrectly routed. To fix this bug, you have to remember about `search_path` as well.
comments:
"RELATION any_id DISTRIBUTION KEY distribution_key_argument_list opt_auto_increment opt_schema_name
...
opt_schema_name:
	SCHEMA any_id {
		$$ = $2
	} | /* EMPTY */ {
		$$ = ""
	}
"
schema sets in schema clause. May be it's not bug, but a language feature. Does we need setup schema by 2 ways?

"ALTER DISTRIBUTION ds1 ATTACH RELATION schema_name.table_name DISTRIBUTION KEY id;"
equals
"ALTER DISTRIBUTION ds1 ATTACH RELATION table_name DISTRIBUTION KEY id SCHEMA schema_name;"

is it right?

Hi!

While both syntaxes are valid, the dot notation is more SQL-way, i think.

Deprecating the SCHEMA keyword version would simplify things and align with common practice. What do you think?

Fixed in https://github.com/pg-sharding/spqr/pull/1298.
@xelavopelk thank you for your contribution!
No, #1298 was only the beginning of fixing problems.

repository.description: Stateless Postgres Query Router.
repository.name: spqr

summary.main: When adding a new table, you can specify a schema. However, during query/transaction routing, the schema is currently ignored, which can lead to incorrect routing of tables with the same name but different schemas.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to include the schema in the table creation, to avoid incorrectly routing tables with the same name but different schemas.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix was to remember the schema during query/transaction routing, to correctly route tables with the same name but different schemas.
summary.otherNotes: The issue was fixed in https://github.com/pg-sharding/spqr/pull/1298, thanks to @xelavopelk's contribution.

issueDTO.title: Category should be displayed for "no barcode" price products
issueDTO.description:
### What
- The following is relevant only for read only price lists. And not for price inputs.
- For "barcode" products, we display the product image and the product name. Then the price, the date, the location, and so on.
- For "no barcode" products, we don't display anything about the product. We just display the price and so on.
- We should display the category (mandatory), the origins (optional), the labels (optional) and the "price per" (unit/kg) (mandatory)

### Steps to reproduce the behavior
1. Go to a price list like "My prices"
2. All the "no barcode" products display nothing about the product itself.

### Expected behavior
We should have the minimum about a "no barcode" product.
Without it, we just know that there's a price, but we don't know if we bought apricots or salmon.

### Screenshot
Here, the first price is about a "no barcode" product:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/df97ab10-e158-404a-9495-8babfad05801)

repository.description: 🤳🥫 The new Open Food Facts mobile application for Android and iOS, crafted with Flutter and Dart
repository.name: smooth-app

summary.main: The issue is about displaying the category for 'no barcode' price products, making it easier to identify the product. The current behavior is to display nothing about the product, making it difficult to know what was bought.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The category is a mandatory field for 'no barcode' products, and the issue is that it is not being displayed.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is relevant only for read-only price lists, not for price inputs. The expected behavior is to display the category, origins, labels, and price per unit/kg for 'no barcode' products, making it easier to identify the product.

issueDTO.title: 🐅 Epic: GPU Support for the Ersilia Model Hub
issueDTO.description:
# GPU Support for the Ersilia Model Hub

## Background

Currently, the Ersilia Model Hub does not support GPU acceleration, which limits the performance of some models — and makes others completely unusable. Models are currently packaged as CPU-only Docker images. The goal of this project is to evaluate and implement GPU support using Docker.

## Goals

- Demonstrate that a model can run inside a Docker container with GPU access.
- Build the foundation to support GPU in the Ersilia infrastructure (template, CLI, metadata, CI/CD).
- Benchmark performance between CPU and GPU runs.

## Step 1: Manual GPU Docker Test (Top-Down)

We will first verify that models can run in a GPU-enabled Docker container, without relying on Ersilia's internal infrastructure (e.g., CLI or model template).

- [ ] Select two test models:
  - [ ] One **GPU-only** model (TBD).
  - [ ] One **GPU/CPU-compatible** model (suggested: FAISS-based).
- [ ] Set up the new GPU workstation.
- [ ] Choose and test an appropriate CUDA base image (e.g., `nvidia/cuda:...`).
- [ ] Ensure image size is acceptable (<~4GB ideally).
- [ ] Run tests on:
  - [ ] At least two local GPU workstations.
  - [ ] One cloud instance (e.g., AWS GPU instance).

## Step 2: Integrate GPU Support into Ersilia Infrastructure

### 🧱 At the [Ersilia Template](https://github.com/ersilia-os/eos-template) level

- [ ] How should `install.yml` indicate GPU requirements?
- [ ] If model code differs between CPU/GPU, how should this be reflected in the `framework/`?

### ⚙️ At the [Ersilia CLI](https://github.com/ersilia-os/ersilia) level

- [ ] Add support for `--gpu` or `--cpu` flags in the `ersilia serve` command.
- [ ] Decide whether GPU/CPU mode should be:
  - Explicit (user-defined via flag), or
  - Automatic (detect from hardware?)
- [ ] Assess: Can one image support both CPU and GPU, or do we need separate ones?

### 📦 At the [Ersilia Metadata](https://github.com/ersilia-os/eos5axz/blob/main/metadata.json) level

- [ ] Add `runtime: GPU` / `CPU` or similar field.
- [ ] Consider `requirements` or `compatibility` sections if needed.

### 🐳 On [DockerHub](https://hub.docker.com/u/ersiliaos)

- [ ] Should GPU-compatible images use a separate tag (e.g., `model:gpu`) or separate repo?
- [ ] Define tagging convention early.

## Step 3: GitHub Actions & CI Integration

In the [Ersilia Model Workflows](https://github.com/ersilia-os/ersilia-model-workflows):

- [ ] Detect whether a model supports GPU.
- [ ] Build and push a GPU-compatible Docker image (using `nvidia-docker`).
- [ ] Ensure existing workflows are not broken.

In the [Ersilia CLI CI/CD](https://github.com/ersilia-os/ersilia):

- [ ] Add at least one unit test to check GPU execution (on GitHub-hosted runners or self-hosted runner with GPU).

## Step 4: Benchmarking & Validation

- [ ] Run performance benchmarks:
  - CPU vs GPU execution time.
  - Memory consumption and constraints.
- [ ] Record any limitations or environment-specific requirements.
comments: Note that I have created a [folder in Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1sNwmeeNtbQUup0Qj66o1ykrwlkPe9Bl_?usp=drive_link) for project-related documentation.

Two minor comments @miquelduranfrigola :
- [x] Support multiple GPUs. There might be more than one GPU in a device and either we have to select one device or sharding tasks accross all available GPUs
- [x] not only nvidia binary but also other accelerators.

- [x] Set up the new GPU workstation. - [ ] Select two test models: - [ ] One GPU-only model - [x] One GPU/CPU-compatible model (suggested: FAISS-based). - [x] Choose and test an appropriate CUDA base image (e.g., nvidia/cuda:...). ## CUDA Base Image: Nvidia has 3 "flavours" images `base`, `runtime` and `devel`. `runtime` seems to be the most appropriate for our use case, necessary runtime and Mathematics Libraries, NCCL and optionally cudNN. For example : ```nvidia/cuda:12.9.0-runtime-ubuntu24.04``` This comes to ~ 2 GB/3 GB depending on the exact CUDA and Ubuntu Version being used. Ideally run automated tests/builds for different combinations of Ubuntu (or other distributions?) and CUDA versions. ## CPU vs GPU preliminary testing A very simple test on TabPFN using a [Sci-Kit Learn Breast Cancer Dataset](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.datasets.load_breast_cancer.html) showed approximately 3x-4x speed ups when GPU access to the process was enabled, compared to CPU only runs (on the Norrsken GPU Workstation). More detailed tests using a [Dataset of approximately 2 Million Compounds](https://github.com/ersilia-os/sars-cov-2-chemspace/blob/main/data/reference_library_inchikeys.csv) showed overwhelming speed-ups with GPU Accelerated similarity searches using [FAISS](https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss), the difference between search times of GPU and CPU implementations scaled/diverged with the Index size. **It is clearly worth trying to accelerate models using GPU Acceleration.** We built indices out of Count Fingerprints of the compounds (converted the SMILES to 2048 Vectors). Cosine Similarity was used as a metric. FAISS does not support cosine by default, so we use an `Inner Product` index and perform L2 (Euclidean) Normalisation on the vectors before adding to them to the index (or before searching), which is the equivalent of using Cosine similarity. Tests were ran with index sizes of `10,000`, `100,000`, `500,000` and `1,000,000`. Nearest 100 Neighbours. ### Index size 100,000: | Number of Searches | CPU (s) | GPU (s) | |--------------------|---------|---------| | 100 | 1 | 0.01 | | 1,000 | 7.08 | 0.04 | | 10,000 | 67.49 | 0.11 | | 100,000 | >350 | 1.30 | | 500,000 | - | 5.50 | ### Index size 1,000,000 | Number of Searches | CPU (s) | GPU (s) | |--------------------|---------|---------| | 100 | 9.42 | 0.02 | | 1,000 | 71 | 0.10 | | 10,000 | 711 | 1.03 | | 100,000 | - | 10.45 | | 500,000 | - | 52.50 | ### _NOTE: GPUs are typically higher latency but have higher parallel throughput and memory bandwidth than CPUs. It is best to use batch queries with the CPU or GPU as this amortises the touching of index memory across all of the queries and this is when GPU speed ups are convenient. We will most likely not see any improvements in GPU search times with single queries (if anything it might be slower because of GPU overhead)._ The examples of inference time comparisons and a 3D plot (inference time against index and query sizes), clearly demonstrate **GPUs provide absolutely non-trivial speed ups for the right tasks.**

# Very Heavy Index (FAISS Flat)

Flat (IP and L2 for example) indices are extremely large (because FAISS only supports Float32 vectors, hence each Fingerprint vector is 32 * 2048 = 65,536 Bits or 4 * 2048=8,192  Bytes), scaling up to millions of vectors means we are dealing with indices that are 10s of GBs.

Tried FPSim2 but there are no benefits to GPU accelerating since it does not support batch queries (could be worth looking into CUDA Programming and tuning it to support batch queries, as it supports Sparse Vectors and Tanimoto Search on GPU)

## Promising alternative to Flat FAISS Index: **Approximate Nearest Neighbour (ANN) search**

Most methods for ANN require index training and parameter tuning which makes building the index more complex. We also need to ensure that the training sample is diverse. 

Please note the difference between training and adding to Indices. And index cannot be trained incrementally but can be incrementally added to.

Memory bottlenecks are also an issue so I first train the index and then add vectors to it incrementally in batches. (Although, it is suggested, If possible at all,  add more compute at index build time. (Especially if the index does not change a lot over time))

The following ANN methods are explored and suggested (compared to ~16 GB with a flat index of around 1.99 million Vectors)

### **_IVFPQ (Inverted File Index with Product Quantisation):_** 

#### **_I am yet to do Accuracy tests on IVFPQ but with computational performance (inference time), models seem to enjoy GPU Acceleration speed ups similar to those mentioned above for FAISS Flat indices._**

This creates very light indices: `~93 MB for an index of around 1.99 Million Vectors`, but there might be a non-trivial loss of accuracy. 

Note: For some reason after the index is trained and incrementally built, FAISS takes a lot of time to write it to disk which makes it look like the process is frozen but isn't actually frozen - it goes into an "uninterruptible sleep" because of Disk IO, as indicated by the "D" state in htop. 

### **_HNSWSQ (Hierarchical Navigable Small World Index with Scalar Quantisation)_**

Training is reasonably fast (with GPU) but adding vectors is computationally intensive and needs to batched appropriately.

#### **_I am yet to do Accuracy tests on HNSWSQ but with computational performance , HNSW seem to enjoy GPU Acceleration only with at Training time as indices are pretty compact and are VERY FAST with CPU and FAISS does not have a GPU search for this yet._**

When choosing the strength of quantisation, there is a trade off between memory and accuracy:

Index of **1.99 million Vectors**:

```
4.63 GB (~2KB Per Vector + overhead) with a  8-Bit Quantiser while maintaining around 95-98% Accuracy^



2.59 GB (~1.15KB Per Vector + overhead) with a 4-Bit Quantiser  while maintaining around 90-95% Accuracy^
```


Adding vectors to this kind of index is slow.

_^accuracy according to official documentation and third party tests_

# Metric Learning - Embedding Model

Another alternative to using vanilla flat indices with 2048 dimensional fingerprints we explore is the use of a metric learning model to create embeddings that are lower dimensions. We use these embeddings to create flat FAISS indices that are much lighter than the standard fingerprint indices (512, 256, 128, 100 dimensional embeddings vs 2048 dimensional fingerprints). We uses torch's GPU version and enjoy non-trivial speed-ups at training time, while creating embeddings and inference time (FAISS Search using a GPU index).

Note: The searches are performed on a flat index, hence are exact searches, but the using of the embedding model means there is an approximation.

We are aiming to create compound similarity search models with 4 compound libraries:

- ChemDiv (100k)
- A representative of Enamine  (~9 million)
- DrugBank (~11k)
- COCONUT (should be between 500k and 1 Million)

We also create a _Metric Learning Embedding Model_ out of a [reference library of 2 million compounds.](https://github.com/ersilia-os/sars-cov-2-chemspace/blob/main/data/reference_library_inchikeys.csv).

For each of the above libraries the aim is to have 3 variants of indices:

- _A flat IP index with L2 Normalisation_
    - This is going to be very large for libraries with 500k+ compounds)

- _A compressed IVFPQ IP index  with L2 normalisation (FAISS compression)_
   - This creates very light indices but as mentioned above there is a loss of search accuracy

- _A flat index created with embeddings from the above mentioned model._
   - This is lets us create indices that are lighter than vanilla flat indices and also lets us have control and confidence over the accuracy of the search (given that we are confident in the embedding model, which is arguably simpler to benchmark).

Implemented a metric learning pipeline that creates learned embeddings from existing flat FAISS index. 

### Transforms 2048-dimensional fingerprints → _256/128/100-dimensional learned embeddings_ with cosine similarity

### Triplet sampling: Uses existing 2M compound FAISS index for mining hard positives/negatives

Evaluations: ROC-AUC, AP, distance distributions, t-SNE visualizations

The pipeline maintains L2 normalization throughout for FlatIP cosine similarity and includes model checkpointing + SMILES mapping for deployment.

Created with PyTorch + FAISS GPU.

issueDTO.title: Allow passing config_path as a parameter to KubernetesExecutor
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Currently, when using executor_config with KubernetesExecutor, the config_file path must be hardcoded. If we try to pass it dynamically using a Jinja template ("{{ params.config_path }}"), it results in an error.

Example of a working static configuration:
```python
executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"config_file": "/opt/airflow/config/kubernetes/docker-desktop-config.yaml"}}
```
However, if we attempt to pass it dynamically, it fails:
```python
executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"config_file": "{{ params.config_path }}"}}
```
This would be useful when deploying DAGs across different environments (e.g., multiple regions) without hardcoding paths.

**Proposed Solution:**

Modify executor_config to allow templating in KubernetesExecutor.config_file, similar to other templated parameters in Airflow.

### Use case/motivation

This would be useful when deploying DAGs across different environments (e.g., multiple regions) without hardcoding paths.
Airflow should allow config_file to accept templated values, resolving them at runtime.
This feature would improve flexibility when running KubernetesExecutor tasks that need different configurations based on dynamic parameters.
Would love to hear thoughts from the community on this! Thanks! 😊

### Related issues


This feature would improve Airflow’s flexibility in hybrid execution environments and align with the goals of[ AIP-61](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/AIP-61+Hybrid+Execution). Would love to hear thoughts from the community on this! 🚀

### Are you willing to submit a PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments: Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template! If you are willing to raise PR to address this issue please do so, no need to wait for approval.

If you can take a look at propose a PR solving it, yes I think it would be useful. But it needs a deep look in the code whether it's possible, also with Airflow 3 changes / Task SDK changes in progress, likely doing it after this is completed, is a good idea.

Are you sure you can rewrite it with?
 ```
executor_config={"KubernetesExecutor": {"config_file": "/opt/airflow/config/kubernetes/docker-desktop-config.yaml"}}
```
I've dug through the code and also experimented a bit, and couldn't find any way to rewrite the initial config file for `KubernetesExecutor`. Am I missing something?  Any  of the `executor_config` I've tried to use with deprecated `KubernetesExecutor` variant except the empty one led to the error:
```
{kubernetes_executor.py:355} ERROR - Invalid executor_config for TaskInstanceKey
```

issueDTO.title: Make subview borders configurable
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Starting in `v7.10.0`, all subviews have a thin border/outline around them to make it easily distinguishable from other elements on the form. We have received feedback from some users that this is not always desirable, for instance when you have a subview within a larger subview, or when the headings clearly separate portions of the form. Some have mentioned they simply prefer the look without them and understand the implications of not clearly segmenting each table. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**

One of two solutions would be acceptable, with the first one being **preferred**.

1. Allow users to configure subview outlines in the XML, setting them to `true` or `false` via an attribute (e.g. `outline`). The default would be `true`.

2. Allow users to completely enable or disable subview outlines in User Preferences

**Reported By**
Marion at Museum für Naturkunde Berlin on the [Speciforum](https://discourse.specifysoftware.org/t/configureg-subview-border/2673)


>For example, in my form, I have the Determiners subview in the Determination subview. I wanted to remove the Determiners subview frame.
>
>![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d1fad119-1bf4-40e8-8876-d913033b153f)

Natalia at KU Invertebrate Paleontology

**Additional context**
This was requested by several users at the SPNHC 2025 workshop as well.
comments:
This issue has been mentioned on **Specify Community Forum**. There might be relevant details there:

https://discourse.specifysoftware.org/t/configuring-the-subview-border/2673/2

issueDTO.title: Add function_body_length to .swiftlint.yml
issueDTO.description:
Like it was done for `closure_body_length` add `function_body_length` to `.swiftlint.yml` with an high threshold in order to avoid a lot of warning. This task is an iterative one since the scope is to reduce the threshold and keep solving the lint issue gradually in small PRs.



┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Task](https://mozilla-hub.atlassian.net/browse/FXIOS-11340)
comments: cc @ionixjunior
Nice, @FilippoZazzeroni! Once I wrap up the `closure_body_length` saga, I’d like to take on this issue.
Yes sure @ionixjunior. Thanks so much 🎉 🎉

@FilippoZazzeroni I've been analyzing the `function_body_length` violations and here is a breakdown of the 147 current violations to help us decide on a starting point:

| Function size (lines) | Number of violations |
|--------|--------|
| 100 - 982 (biggest) | 21 |
| 90 - 99 | 9 |
| 80 - 89 | 13 |
| 70 - 79 | 23 |
| 60 - 69 | 38 | 
| 51 - 59 | 43 | 

The standard SwiftLint threshold is 50 lines. Based on this data, what do you think would be a realistic initial target for us to aim for? I believe this can be important to understand when this issue can be closed. Also, we could document this target in the issue's title or description.

Hi @ionixjunior sorry for answering late, i think we should do like we did with `closure_body_length`. We should first enforce the rule with a super high threshold that could be the lower value after the 982 line function and for each PR we lower the threshold.

issueDTO.title: [ui] - Fixing spacings in the comment section
issueDTO.description: > Do you have attention to detail and would like to work on making the UI nicer? This issue is then for you! :)) ## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. 1. Comment section is still not matching the designs. The whitespace is lacking between the nested comments and the visually it looks tight, packed and overwhelming. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c6340e9d-7671-4308-acd0-10bf42bffd4b) 2. Additionally the comment on mobile has spacing from the left, leaving the space not being utilised and making the text unnecessarily squeezed. Especially with nested comments it becomes obvious: 3. If the comment has some enters for new line and the the Show more button shows, it creates an awkward space. There is also gap applied. ## Describe the solution you'd like Generally I think this will need not only adjusting the numbers, but some minor restructuring of the divs. So, let me try to number the improvements: --- 1. Improving the spacings between the nested comments. In the designs there are also the useful buttons in each comment, that are not yet implemented. In the design however, the spacing occurs naturally because of the useful buttons, so I did not need to add a big margin-bottom. I will leave the solution here up to you, but account for the fact that one day in the future we will introduce the useful button for the comment. Don't be afraid to be generous with the spacings, in the devtools i tried 50px as in my designs --- 2. Mobile improvement. Here I upload a gif of the solution that I utilised in the Figma designs - it was to hide the left column with the avatar, allowing the text to stretch and then showing the avatar next to the username in 30x30px size. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/329f7267-8bdb-4d18-a47c-73b7e44d5478) Don't forget to make sure that the author's badge is working --- 3. Putting the Show More button directly under the comment, trimming the whitespaces. --- 4. Decreasing the gap here to 5px from 10px --- 5. As you can see, on mobile it gets quite tight. I would suggest removing the word Published from the "Published x time ago" information for the comments. --- 6. OPTIONAL - In case you would want to act on the point 5. above even more, I would suggest for mobile screens shortening the formulation even more, saying for example 1h ago, 3mo ago or 2yr ago. Reddit does it this way as well. --- 7. OPTIONAL - In case you would still be up for a challenge, having these 2 aligned on the baseline would be a nice achievement, however I didn't manage to get the desired result, since as you can see below, the align-items:baseline does not align them. ## Additional context - [FIGMA FILE HERE](https://www.figma.com/design/XYV3fr8UVOdkNyBmKHHR7f/CP---Comments-Useful---Mobile?node-id=48-79) You can find the figma file above. You can see the components, the desktop and the mobile versions. These design include the correct answer feature or the useful buttons, which are not yet implemented, so feel free to ignore those. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask. :))
comments:
@benfurber - I can take this up!

Although, if we are adding margin to fill the space where the useful count will go for comments, is there any reason not to go and implement the useful counter for comments? I'd be happy to include that as well.

Heyy @JCSergent! Cool to see that you are up for tackling these design improvements. 

Just yesterday we were talking with Ben, that this issue was in his opinion hard to follow and that the screenshots I included could be a bit confusing (some of them with the useful button, some without), so I thought about rewriting it. Is the issue clear to you though? If so, than let's keep it and if you find anything even slightly unclear you can tag me in the comments at any time and I'll be happy to give more clarification. :))

Also Ben mentioned that he does not have the capacity to prioritise this at the moment, so this would actually be really really helpful and valuable contribution from you. <3

Ben was also wrote yesterday that some of the points I mentioned were implemented already. After checking, it was only the point 5. - removing the word "Published" from the timestamp.

I will ask the team about implementing the useful counter and let you know. :))

@dalibormrska  - I think I understand it, but here let me try to summarize and let me know if I am understanding your requests correctly.


Request 1: Increase spacing between the nested comments.
Solutions:
- Long Term Solution: Add the Useful Counter to comments which will naturally add whitespace between the comments
- Easier Solution: Manually add whitespace between the nested comments (which is the space the Useful Counter will take up later)

Request 2: When viewing comments (especially reply comments) in mobile, the comment text is extremely narrow.
Solution: Remove the left side margin (make the comment text and profile image be on the same vertical line). Use the smaller version of the profile picture. Basically try to get to this design:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a4045704-088e-4a7c-a7ff-bf3d1c5535b3)

Request 3: If a comment has alot of line breaks, there could be an awkward gap between the comment text and the 'Show more' button
Solution: Remove line breaks from the end of the comment when hiding the rest of the comment behind the 'Show more' button

Request 4: Decrease Gap between profile/upload date line and comment body from 10px to 5px
Solution: This is straight forward :), just decrease gap from 10px to 5px

Request 5: Remove the 'Published ... time ago' part of the upload date to save space
Solution: Already Done :)

Request 6 (OPTIONAL): The upload date still takes alot of space on mobile
Solution: Use time short hand in mobile. For example, use '5h ago' instead of '5 hours ago' or '4mo ago' instead of '4 months ago'

Request 7 (OPTIONAL): The user flag, user name, and upload date are not aligned
Solution: Align the 3 on the baseline

Cool, well summarised, it's pretty much spot-on. :)) The only thing that got trickier since then is the Request 4. If you run the project locally or are a beta-tester, you will see that now the three-dots menu next to the top-comment has been implemented. The three-dots button is huge however, which makes the whole header of the top-comment taller than the replies and therefore makes it hard to achieve consistent gap. I don't know however what makes the most sense from the coding best practices - but I imagine if you tackle the Request 2. and include the avatar image in the comment header, then the whole header will get the height of the image. I would then suggest trying to make the image size and the three-dots menu size the same - let's try 35x35px and adjusting the gap accordingly. Other than that we just wait for @benfurber to assign. :))

I'm sceptical of making the avatar too small, otherwise what's the point of showing it.

It's yours @JCSergent.

One thing to note, I'm about to implement some icon changes which includes the pointing down arrow in these screenshots.

issueDTO.title: Table - sortable demo servers column sorting is incorrect
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the enhancement or change**
From the 9/16/2024 design share session, there was a question brought up regarding the PF [sortable table demo](https://www.patternfly.org/components/table/react-demos/sortable---responsive/). Basically it seems like when the "Servers" column is sorted in ascending order, the column is actually sorting in a sort of reverse alphabetical order ("US-Node-1" comes first instead of "Bangalore-Node 1"). The other columns sort in the expected order based on the sort type.

As part of this we should take stock of other sortable demos/examples to ensure they're sorting correctly as expected (ignoring columns that don't utilize text, i.e. a "favorites" column that only has a star icon button; this will be handled by https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly-react/issues/11006)

**Is this request originating from a Red Hat product team? If so, which ones and is there any sort of deadline for this enhancement?**

**Any other information?**

issueDTO.title: VM Detection is not working on MacOS
issueDTO.description:
I am using Macbook Air M1 and inside that I am using UTM-MacOS-VM but its not detecting it as virtual machine.

UTM - https://mac.getutm.app/
comments:
@AdnanAhad Hi! thanks for the issue.

I’ve never heard of UTM-VM, and it’s not on our supported brand list but that doesn’t mean the lib shouldn’t work. Although you say it didn’t work, were there any techniques that says it detected? 

In the meantime, I’ll try to find something that could be used as a detection in UTM-VM, but there’s no guarantees. It’s a hard process and the codebase for that project is huge.

It’s also worth noting that MacOS techniques aren’t our speciality. Although we support it, we don’t really maintain it as Linux and Windows are the most demanded platforms for this sort of project.

@kernelwernel Thanks for the response, 


But I think I have found the solution for that, I have added one more check for detection of Hypervisor in MAC and it helped me.

`sysctl kern.hv_vmm_present` 

it helped me to detect UTM.

@AdnanAhad That’s incredibly useful to know, thanks! What does that command output for UTM exactly? I’d like to know so I can add an official new technique to the library. Credit will also be given obviously :)

repository.description: VM detection library and tool
repository.name: VMAware

summary.main: The issue is that VM detection is not working on MacOS, specifically on a MacBook Air M1 using UTM-MacOS-VM.
summary.validationOrRequirement: VM detection is not working on MacOS
summary.attemptedFixes: Added one more check for detection of Hypervisor in MAC and it helped to detect UTM. The command `sysctl kern.hv_vmm_present` was used.
summary.otherNotes: UTM - https://mac.getutm.app/

```
[DEBUG] HYPERVISOR_STR:
eax: 0
ebx: 0
ecx: 0
edx: 0
```
You can see in that all hypervisor registers are all zeroes.

I know that a normal hypervisor will return a bendstring when calling CPUID EAX=0x40000000. However, it is a bit strange to see that it is detected as a VM even though it is all 0.

..Maybe it's because of x86 emulating.

We've had issues with Microsoft discretely fiddling around with low-level stuff that it shouldn't modify and making them seem like it's a VM, so this isn't a new story for us but it's still important to address nonetheless. While I don't have a fix yet, we've previously encountered a very similar issue before (https://github.com/kernelwernel/VMAware/issues/359) and all we've done to fix it was by detecting binary translation environments and blacklisting (if found) for those specific techniques, and I'm pretty sure this is the path we'll take but I need to consult with my co-dev (@NotRequiem) who manages these techniques. I assume he's sleeping at the moment, but I'll let him know about the issue.

> You can see in that all hypervisor registers are all zeroes.

That technique isn't really relevant in this scenario, it's relatively common to have that output.

> I know that a normal hypervisor will return a bendstring when calling CPUID EAX=0x40000000. However, it is a bit strange to see that it is detected as a VM even though it is all 0.

I assume you meant "brand string" instead of bendstring, but this is also not surprising since it's a binary translator. I *assume* you have Microsoft PRISM doing the x86 to ARM translation, which isn't really accurate to call it an emulator in itself but that's besides the point.

A lot of funky stuff happens when the binary is being translated to a different ISA, but we still do our best to keep it as compatible as possible with the same core mechanisms we've done for real x86 hardware. We'll let you when there's a fix available.

I see now that the issue was more complex than I initially thought. It seems I was looking in the wrong direction. I would appreciate it if you could kindly let me know again if there are any revisions.

We'll make a new bug fix release right after fixing this issue, false positives are quite a severe problem to us no matter the circumstances. I'll definitely let you know when it's done (shouldn't take more than 2 days).

Ok, I'm awake now.

Your TPM manufacturer stands for "MSFT" (Microsoft), which is now whitelisted.

Your system does not contain any SSDT table, which is weird. Since there are no public dumps available of Microsoft Surface Pro 11 (as far as i know), I took dumps of other versions of Surface Pro devices to make that firmware check, specifically:
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Laptop/4CA7E4FC50A4
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Laptop%203/4E426AB8062D
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Pro/773032238BB5
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Pro%203/074C5C2E091B

I whitelisted Surface pro 11 devices from the SSDT check until i get more firmware dumps of those devices.

summary.main: The issue is related to the x86 emulation layer (WoA - Windows on ARM) on real physical machines, which exposes properties that trigger VM detection mechanisms, especially those related to firmware and TPM manufacturer inspection. The issue was initially thought to be related to the TPM check, but it was later found that the problem was more complex.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue was initially thought to be related to the TPM check, but it was later found that the problem was more complex. The developer (@NotRequiem) took dumps of other versions of Surface Pro devices to make that firmware check.
summary.attemptedFixes:
The issue was initially thought to be related to the TPM check, but it was later found that the problem was more complex. The developer (@NotRequiem) took dumps of other versions of Surface Pro devices to make that firmware check, specifically:
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Laptop/4CA7E4FC50A4
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Laptop%203/4E426AB8062D
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Pro/773032238BB5
https://github.com/linuxhw/ACPI/blob/master/Tablet/Microsoft/Surface/Surface%20Pro%203/074C5C2E091B

The TPM check should not flag now, but the developer needs to know if the user flags any other firmware heuristic.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the x86 emulation layer (WoA - Windows on ARM) on real physical machines, which exposes properties that trigger VM detection mechanisms, especially those related to firmware and TPM manufacturer inspection.

issueDTO.title: Add a general delay between crawl requests
issueDTO.description:
### Problem Description

Currently users cannot configure a delay between crawl requests. A simple x seconds delay configurable from the yaml file would allow users to slow down crawls.

This is similar to https://github.com/elastic/crawler/issues/46 (abiding by `Crawl-delay` in robots.txt). However, a general delay would be useful for users who can't or don't want to change the robots.txt.

When both are implemented, the highest value of the two should be used for the crawl delay.

### Proposed Solution

Add a configurable crawl delay in yaml file.

### Additional Context

Link to discuss forum: https://discuss.elastic.co/t/apply-delay-between-requests-in-elastic-crawler/361375/4

summary.main: Add a general delay between crawl requests. Currently users cannot configure a delay between crawl requests. A simple x seconds delay configurable from the yaml file would allow users to slow down crawls.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Add a configurable crawl delay in yaml file.
summary.otherNotes: Link to discuss forum: https://discuss.elastic.co/t/apply-delay-between-requests-in-elastic-crawler/361375/4

issueDTO.title: Use XDG standard for directories
issueDTO.description:
### 🚀 Describe the new functionality needed

Currently, the project uses ~ (home directory) directly for storing configuration and data files. I propose we switch to following the [XDG Base Directory Specification](https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html) because:
* Standardization: XDG paths are the standard across Linux and many Unix-like environments, improving consistency.
* Flexibility: Allows users to customize locations via environment variables (XDG_CONFIG_HOME, XDG_DATA_HOME), avoiding clutter in the home directory.
* Compatibility: Better aligns with modern best practices and other open-source tools.
* Cross-platform: Provides a clearer way to handle config/data locations on different OSes.

### 💡 Why is this needed? What if we don't build it?

Consistency!

### Other thoughts

_No response_
comments: Can i work on this ?
thank you 🙏🏽
This story is a little bit related to #2139, or at least should be considered together

issueDTO.title: [Margin app] Create /signup endpoint (email only)
issueDTO.description:
## Guideline
1. Carefully read the issue description before applying to ensure you have all the necessary information to start working on it.
2. Write a brief description of how you will approach the task (without using ChatGPT).
3. Add your Telegram handler in your application (e.g., in OnlyDust or similar)
4. Write ETA in your application



## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.
3. Do not send DM to maintainer, it would be better and faster to ask other contributors in chat 


## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2.  Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3.  Do not commit changes which is not related to your task 
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything.

## Task description  
1. Create a `POST /signup` endpoint that accepts only the user's email in the request body:
```json
{
  "email": "user@example.com"
}
```

2. Check if the email already exists in the database (e.g. pre-created by a super admin).
3. If valid, generate a JWT token that encodes the email.
4. Send a confirmation email with a link in the following format:

```python
f'{app_base_url}/signup-confirmation?token={token}'
```

5. Add `app_base_url` to your settings (if it's not already present).
6. Do not return any sensitive info in the response.
7. Add appropriate tests to cover:

   * New signup attempt
   * Already existing email
   * Proper link generation
   * Email delivery trigger

**NOTE: This refers to the admin entity**

issueDTO.description:
Type : Molécule

Nom : Click_Item

Objectifs :

- Crée la molécule Click item pour AXA.fr et l'Espace Client

---

Le Click Item est une molecule interactif conçu pour déclencher une action lorsqu’il est sélectionné. Il peut être utilisé seul ou intégré dans des listes, menus ou tableaux pour permettre des interactions rapides et intuitives.

Structure : 

ℹ️ Utilisation de l'atome "_Icon"
ℹ️ Utilisation de l'atome "_Click_Icon"
ℹ️ Utilisation de l'atome "_tag"
ℹ️ Utilisation de l'atome "_Spinner"
ℹ️ Utilisation de l'atome "_Base_picture"

Device : --Desk / --Mob
Size : --small / --medium / --large / --agent
States : --default / --hover / --disabled / --loading

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/79fd5d3d-e6e2-45dc-b4ac-2f2b71d86732)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/00a9f20f-a07f-4332-b040-cb51897d162d)

issueDTO.title: 📦 App Packaging 📦
issueDTO.description:
(Still incomplete) TODO list about packaging problems/features to be solved/implemented for the various operating systems.

<hr>

### Windows

- [ ] The installer doesn't remove previously installed instances of the app
- [ ] There is a command-line window opening and closing quickly at the end of the _Windows_ setup wizard since no other _WixToolset_ feature for running commands quietly worked as expected.
- [ ] The sample graphics used for the _Windows_ installer should be modified. Since transparency is supported, I suggest the dialog background be limited to the left side only to follow the standards and fix the visual issues there. The same can apply to the banner image, traditionally only an icon was shown on the right side of it.
- [ ] Sign the package

<hr>

### macOS

- [x] ~~Possibility to run cargo bundle without building again~~ (solved by manually building the .app file)
- [ ] The wrapper script to open the app on macOS should be changed (#197)
- [ ] Add Homebrew cask as per #309
- [ ] Sign the package

<hr>

### Linux

- [ ] AppImage, Flatpak, and other kinds of packages
- [ ] Build and publish a Debian Source Package
comments: Feel free to list other problems/features that come to your mind and I'll add them @4r7if3x
Could be worth getting an SSL certificate to sign the Windows package. Otherwise Windows Defender gets upset that it is an unknown publisher.

> Could be worth getting an SSL certificate to sign the Windows package. Otherwise Windows Defender gets upset that it is an unknown publisher.

Yep, absolutely. I immediately add it to the set of features.
And similarly should also be done for macOS...

@GyulyVGC You'd need a registered company and enlist it with D&B to obtain a _Code Signing Certificate_. Besides, you can buy them cheaper from resellers such as [GoGetSSL](https://www.gogetssl.com/code-signing-ssl/).
Dang, I was hoping for a for a free solution but it may be utopian.
This may be an option for you: https://github.com/axodotdev/cargo-dist

> Dang, I was hoping for a for a free solution but it may be utopian.

Hi Giuliano (@GyulyVGC),

Perhaps you can check out [SignPath for Open Source projects](https://about.signpath.io/product/open-source)?

Kind Regards,
Liam
Thanks, will check!

I've been looking at packaging for Flatpak and AppImage for the last couple days.

While I can get it compiling into an installable and launchable Flatpak, I end up with the issue that it can't be granted the capabilities required. I looked at Wireshark's Flatpak to see if they worked around that, but it turns out they just patch it to say it can't be used to capture. 

AppImage has the same problem, I tried writing a wrapper script that grants the capabilities when the AppImage is run, but elevated commands (tried both sudo and pkexec to elevate) don't seem to have read or write access to the mount point in /tmp/ the AppImage files are in. It does however work if you elevate the entire AppImage.

issueDTO.title: Cray + NVIDIA GPU on NCSA Delta
issueDTO.description:
This is an example of how to use Cray compilers (17.0) on NCSA Delta with A100 devices for a minimal OpenACC program `test.f90`. It still needs to be integrated with MFC and ensured it works.

```shell
module load nvhpc
module load PrgEnv-cray
```

```shell
export CUDA_HOME=/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-x86_64/gcc-8.5.0/cuda-12.3.0-7oylpzc
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=${CUDA_HOME}/lib64:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}
```

`ftn -haccel=nvidia80 -hacc -craype-verbose -M 296,878,1391,1069,5025 -h dynamic -h acc_model=auto_async_none -h acc_model=no_fast_addr -o test test.f90 -L/usr/lib64 -lcudart -L${CUDA_HOME}/lib64`


I found a better way to do this but it's more complicated. I need to put the description of how to do it in this GH issue. The above way isn't really reasonable, it would need many changes to the cmake file and it isn't worth it. I have a workaround that does the trick without many changes. Has to be on DeltaAI though.

But, at the moment on DeltaAI we cannot have runners. So, we might make it an option (so that users can do it) by modifying the necessary templates and such.

The goal of the issue is to make it so people can use cray compilers to offload to NVIDIA GPU devices and ensure their code works. Many folks don't have access to Frontier for Cray compilers with AMD GPU offloading, but DeltaAI is broadly available and had Cray compilers + NV GPUs which is a helpful debugging point.

issueDTO.title: Add GPU profiling to CI
issueDTO.description: Add GPU profiling on Phoenix to CI with nsight sys.
comments: Likely has to be done by someone at Gatech and so access to Phoenix for debugging purposes.
More detail: Should run MFC profiling on a GPU node and write the command line results to CI. Should probably compare results to known results from master (like the benchmark workflow does).

Simple poc to generate non-gpu nsys report in the CI https://github.com/Malmahrouqi3/MFC-mo2/actions/runs/15799705418/job/44536371819
To process the results for single/multiple report(s), Nsight Systems UI would do it. I do not know about how to do diff, but surely there has to be a way via nsys cli.

No sure yet how it is gonna behave with Phoenix, but integrating this into self-hosted `test.yml` is the way.
Also, never tested it, but I guess it is possible to profile a run locally using the workflow file with github cli `gh act -P ubuntu-latest=-self-hosted -W .github/workflows/profiling.yml` or by simply installing Nsights then `nsys profile -o report ./mfc.sh test -a --gpu`

@Malmahrouqi3 thanks, yes you can add it that way, it's a good POC. you actually just pass different commands to the nsys command, `nsys --help` or whatever, and it will give you the information on the command line and you would just dump that into the output of the CI. I'm not sure if a diff is the best way to go or not (presumably that would go into benchmarking since it would have to be PR vs. Master). 

The easiest way to get a merge in, that could possibly be migrated to benchmarking later, would be to just run the nsys command with appropriate flags, and it will tell you what the most expensive subroutines are. We have some documentation on nsight profiling in the MFC docs `./mfc.sh run <...> --profile` should work I think. But I think that will just create a report file you look at in the GUI.
`NVHPC_ACC_TIME` or `NVCOMPILER_ACC_TIME` may be an easy workaround for this. Should just work at runtime.

issueDTO.title: lakectl fs upload refuses to create an object path with a trailing slash
issueDTO.description:
## Expected

Can create an object path with a trailing slash.

## Actual

```sh
❯ lakectl -c fs upload lakefs://ev-test/main/dir-with-marker/  -s /dev/null
target path is not a valid URI
Error executing command.
```

## Impact

If I _need_ a directory marker empty object, I cannot use it.

### Workaround

`aws s3api put-object` (the Boto CLI) does not enforce incorrect ideas about URIs, and works.

issueDTO.title: [Margin app] Create assets statistic handler
issueDTO.description:
## Guideline
1. Carefully read the issue description before applying to ensure you have all the necessary information to start working on it.
2. Write a brief description of how you will approach the task (without using ChatGPT).
3. Add your Telegram handler in your application (e.g., in OnlyDust or similar)
4. Write ETA in your application



## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.
3. Do not send DM to maintainer, it would be better and faster to ask other contributors in chat 


## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2. Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3. Do not commit changes that are unrelated to your task
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything


## Task Description
1. In the [handlers folder](./blob/main/margin/margin_app/app/telegram/handlers), create a new file named `admin.py`. Inside, add a handler called `/assets`. Use the [`Admin Filter` from this issue](https://github.com/djeck1432/spotnet/issues/915) to verify the user is an admin. Then, call the [`Assets statistic` method from this issue](https://github.com/djeck1432/spotnet/issues/906) to retrieve the data. Format the response using Telegram Markdown so it displays neatly.
2. Provide a screenshot demonstrating that the handler works as expected.

issueDTO.title: UI - Graph option selector DagRun and Versions
issueDTO.description:
### Body

When we select a DagRun, automatically the Version will be changed to match the one of the dagrun and display the relevant structure of the dagrun, that's great.

When we do the opposite, for instance we select different versions for a specific dagrun it will display the version structure and try to match the execution of the DagRun on it. It makes sense for DagRun with multiple versions, but I don't think we should be able to explore DagVersions that are not part of the selected dagrun at all. 

It makes it hard to follow when we start playing with the `version selector` when a DagRun is selected. (Is the DagVersion that I have selected part of the DagRun.dag_versions, or am I watching a completely unrelated structure)


For instance in the following image I have the `v2` structure displayed for a DagRun that actually only has `v4` part of his versions. The output graph doesn't make much sense.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb45d6a5-514f-464e-b756-39c8b0a70c39)


I do not know yet what is the best way to address this, any idea is welcome.
### Committer

- [x] I acknowledge that I am a maintainer/committer of the Apache Airflow project.
comments: cc: @bbovenzi I'd like your opinion on this
Hey! Can I work on this?
Makes sense to me!

issueDTO.title: Bug - Impossible to load UI if user does not have read permissions on plugins
issueDTO.description:
### Body

Plugins are loaded at the start of the web application to be able to fill extra menu items in the navbar.

Authenticated users but without `read` permissions on plugins will get a `403` forbidden error on that endpoint. That error is handled in a way that prevent the rest of the application to render and show a `Forbidden` page.

~~We should instead fail gracefully and continue rendering the UI even if extra plugins menu items cannot be fetched because the user does not have access. This way user can still use the default UI.~~

We want all user to be able to see extra menu items coming from the plugins. We should add an entry in the [ui/config](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/airflow-core/src/airflow/api_fastapi/core_api/routes/ui/config.py#L49) enpoints with `plugins_extra_menu_items` there (iterate over plugins `appbuilder_menu_items`), so all authenticated users can see them. Plug the UI on this new config attribute, not calling the `public/providers` endpoint anymore.

### Committer

- [x] I acknowledge that I am a maintainer/committer of the Apache Airflow project.
comments:
I can take this issue
Great, @tanujdargan you are assigned, I have updated the issue with another approach that might be better and easier. Let me know if that make sense.

repository.description: Apache Airflow - A platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows
repository.name: airflow

summary.main: The bug occurs when plugins are loaded at the start of the web application and authenticated users without `read` permissions on plugins get a `403` forbidden error on that endpoint, preventing the rest of the application from rendering.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to fail gracefully and continue rendering the UI even if extra plugins menu items cannot be fetched because the user does not have access.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue is assigned to @tanujdargan and has an updated approach that might be better and easier to implement.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is about fixing a bug where users without read permissions on plugins are unable to load the UI. The issue is labeled as a good first issue and has a priority of medium.

Please DO NOT use the issue tracker to ask questions.

Documentation issues should be posted to https://github.com/jreleaser/jreleaser.github.io/issues

### Task List

### Steps to Reproduce

The directory includes artifacts that meet the CR requirements, along with PGP signatures for every file. I'm fairly sure, given the actual error below, that the artifacts themselves don't matter.

I have the following `jreleaser.toml`:

```
[deploy.maven.mavenCentral.sonatype]
active = "ALWAYS"
sign = false
url = "https://central.sonatype.com/api/v1/publisher"
stagingRepositories = ["build/maven"]
```

I run jreleaser:

```
$ env \
JRELEASER_MAVENCENTRAL_USERNAME="${MAVEN_CENTRAL_USERNAME}" \
JRELEASER_MAVENCENTRAL_PASSWORD="${MAVEN_CENTRAL_PASSWORD}" \
JRELEASER_PROJECT_JAVA_GROUP_ID="${JRELEASER_PROJECT_JAVA_GROUP_ID}" \
JRELEASER_PROJECT_VERSION="${JRELEASER_PROJECT_VERSION}" \
./jreleaser deploy --config-file=jreleaser.toml
```

comments: Have you tried with a newer version of GraalVM?

I've just realized I failed to mention that this is the executable taken from the latest [jreleaser-native-1.19.0-linux-x86_64.zip](https://github.com/jreleaser/jreleaser/releases/download/v1.19.0/jreleaser-native-1.19.0-linux-x86_64.zip).

Having seen this kind of error before, I'm guessing this is a Graal native image miscompilation. Some resources might be loaded via reflection, and that's not being handled when GraalVM tries to produce an executable.

Oh, I see. This could mean the native image generator procedure may be missing some explicit resources. This kinda makes sense now. 

As an alternative you could switch to the jreleaser-standalone distribution which includes a custom Java runtime, or use the regular jreleaser distribution which would require you to configure a Java 11 (as a minimum) runtime.

issueDTO.title: `run --recursive` and `run --filter` do not "fail" when no packages have the script
issueDTO.description:
<!--
  If this issue affects many people in a company/big team, create a post for your company in the following discussion:
  https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/discussions/3787
  and link the issue in your post.

  This will help us prioritize issues that affect more people.
-->

### pnpm version: `8.5.1`

### Code to reproduce the issue:

In a multi-package workspace where "does_not_exist" is a script in no packages.

```shell
$ pnpm -r run does_not_exist && echo "hi"
Scope: 19 of 20 workspace projects
None of the selected packages has a "does_not_exist" script
ha
```

### Expected behavior:

echo should never be executed

```shell
$ pnpm -r run does_not_exist && echo "hi"
Scope: 19 of 20 workspace projects
None of the selected packages has a "does_not_exist" script
```

### Actual behavior:

echo is executed, run does not fail.

From the [docs](https://pnpm.io/cli/run#--recursive--r):  **If none of the packages have the command, the command fails.**

```shell
$ pnpm -r run does_not_exist && echo "hi"
Scope: 19 of 20 workspace projects
None of the selected packages has a "does_not_exist" script
 ha
```

and an example in github actions: https://github.com/functionless/eventual/actions/runs/5616119079/job/15217864354?pr=395#step:5:2

### Additional information:

 - `node -v` prints: v18.14.2
 - Windows, macOS, or Linux?: linux (WSL & github actions)
comments:
Actually, this was done like this by design. See related issue: https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/issues/1763
and related PR: https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/pull/2090

Maybe it would be better to revert those changes as they could just use the `--if-present` CLI flag (cc @bdchauvette)
There is also a --no-bail option as well. It is impossible to make it work like the docs specify unless you parse the output text. --no-bail and --if-present cannot be reversed.
Then we should correct the documentation.
same issue with `pnpm@7.33.5`

@kwaszczuk I had the same idea and filed this issue https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/issues/9710 this should be relatively simple to implement afaict. I opened a dummy PR in the place where it seems like this should happen.
Oddly enough I cannot find anywhere in the codebase where that flag is currently used outside of a test..
